You have a degree in Business Information Systems or a comparable course of study as well as several years of experience in the field of Business Intelligence and are looking for an exciting challenge in a dynamic, internationally operating company. In addition, you have:

You will enable data-based enterprise management by preparing and merging raw data and making it available using modern BI technologies.
You will be the contact person for existing reports their data quality, and you will be available to our internal customers in an advisory capacity.
You will create suitable evaluations for complex inquiries.
You will develop ideas to continuously optimize data storage, processing, and provision.

We Appreciate:

You have a degree in Business Information Systems or a comparable course of study as well as several years of experience in the field of Business Intelligence and are looking for an exciting challenge in a dynamic, internationally operating company. In addition, you have:

Confident handling of SQL, knowledge of the MS SQL Server stack and SQL Server Analysis Services is advantageous.
Initial experience in report development with common tools (ideally Microsoft SSRS and Power BI).
Analytical skills and enjoy communicating at all levels of the organization.

A high degree of initiative, a quick grasp and enthusiasm for exciting tasks.
Application-safe MS Office skills as well as a good command of English.

About IONOS

IONOS is the leading European digitalization partner for small and medium-sized businesses (SMB). The company serves around six million customers and operates across 18 markets in Europe and North America, with its services being accessible worldwide. With its Web Presence & Productivity portfolio, IONOS acts as a 'one-stop shop' for all digitalization needs: from domains and web hosting to classic website builders and do-it-yourself solutions, from e-commerce to online marketing tools. In addition, the company offers Cloud Solutions to enterprises who are looking to move to the cloud as their businesses evolve.

We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

description:
About TPV Technology

TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.

About TP Vision

TP Vision is a consumer electronics key player in the world of audio visual digital entertainment. TP Vision concentrates on developing, manufacturing and marketing Philips branded TV sets (Europe, Russia, Middle East, South America, India and selected countries in Asia-Pacific) and audio products (all around the Globe). We do this by combining the innovative Philips brand heritage with our design expertise, operational excellence, flexibility and speed of TPV Technology. With these combined strengths, we bring high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. We believe in creating products that offer a superior audio and visual experience for consumers. With Philips TVs, TP Vision is a global leader in the hospitality market. TP Vision is the exclusive brand licensee of Philips TVs for the above listed countries and, on the global stage for the Philips audio products.TP Vision employs close to 2,000 people in several locations around the globe and is 100% owned by TPV, one of the world‚Äôs leading monitor and LCD TV manufacturers, selling and marketing Philips branded TVs in China. TPV has been able to drive its growth over the years by leveraging its economies of scale and core competencies in R&D, manufacturing, logistic efficiency and quality.

Scope

You will be responsible for the preparation and the implementation of the Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)-Directive. The first year will be focused on the execution of a double materiality assessment, gap assessment of the CSR-Directive criteria and an EU Taxonomy assessment. After these assessments you will define the roadmap and coordinate with the data owners how to comply with the CSR-Directive.

What Do We Offer You

A new, fulltime position and flexible working (from our refurbished European HQ office in Amsterdam, opposite from Amstel station, and from home)
An entrepreneurial, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment, working with great brands
Fast decision-making environment / flat organisation
Competitive remunerationEducation And Related Experience

Master‚Äôs Degree in a relevant field
5-10 years proven experience in Sustainability or Compliance
Knowledge of Integrated & sustainability reporting standards and EcoVadis methodology
Fluent in English
Excellent project management skills
Proven track record in independent project management (including budgets, timelines, deliverables and reporting)
Strong analytics skills and communication skills
Strong experience in internal and external stakeholder management
Ambition to grow sustainability skills and the drive to successfully manage multiple projects running at the same time
Critical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, stakeholder management skills within and outside the company, and within multicultural diverse organizations
Ambitious, pro-active, high drive for getting-things-done
Able to work independently in dynamic fast changing business environmentMore Info

If you enjoy working with knowledgeable, success-oriented people, for a company that both challenges and respects its professionals, and you've got what it takes to be a great Sustainability Reporting Specialist, then apply today. Please contact Monique Manger (Corporate Recruiter) at info@careersattpvision.com (please include your CV and a short motivation).

Acquisition as a result of this vacancy posting is not appreciated.

description:
About The Job

Initiated by CPL Portugal Hub ‚Äì OPTI to provide performance measure and more generally end to end reporting on the main compliance processes that are now well recognized as high value added services for compliance and the business
The aim is to create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support the Compliance Portugal Hub Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management
In this frame, the Head Portugal Hub would like to recruit a Data Analyst
Your Main Activities Are

Reporting maintenance and data refresh / produce based on the established frequency the relevant dashboards
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders
Develop knowledge on both systems used for reporting production in order to become quickly autonomous
Be able to provide explanation on the calculus methods and formulas for the main indicators
Profile And Skills To Success

Bachelor Degree in Business / IT / Data Science & Analytics
Up to 2 years of relevant experience in Reporting and Data Modeling / Mining
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Data Viz, Blending , Analytics: Power Bi, Tableau softwares
Proactivity
Ability to collaborate / Teamwork
Creativity & Innovation / Problem solving
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Ability to develop and adapt a process
Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution
BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal
Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

International reach
BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success.

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance
At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions
At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

description:
The Search Group is a Risk and Research consultancy firm with a global footprint, and an enhanced presence in both Europe and East Asia. Our global clients rely upon us for due diligence, business intelligence, and specialist research products. We are also available to assist clients develop their ethics and governance programs - covering regulatory and financial crime compliance, ESG and business conduct. TSG is growing quickly hence is looking for motivated and committed people to join our local and global teams across all areas.

Job Summary

As Research Analyst you will be part of our Operations team and will report directly to the Regional Manager. You will be an individual contributor; however, you will also be working with our more Senior Research Analysts and Editors to help on projects and their professional development As a Research Analyst, you will conduct research on internet and web-based media databases, and write high-quality reports on companies and/or individuals using a combination of publicly-available and proprietary sources. In this role, you must ensure that the reports and daily updates meet the requirements in terms of content quality, accuracy, timeliness and completeness by establishing and monitoring adherence The Search Group‚Äôs leading standards.

Role And Responsibilities

Conduct research on internet or web-based media databases.

Produce high quality reports involving research and Analysis in different languages. For this position it is required that the candidate is fluent in English and Russian
Conduct first level quality control through peer review
Carry out watchlist database screening on the subjects of the Due Diligence checks
Provide input on the report writing process to help improve the quality and efficiency of the Research team
Engage with the Research team in other offices, seeking feedback, obtaining updates, managing delivery expectation on the quality of reports
Remain knowledgeable of regional and industry trends
Partner with other teams to ensure the integrity of key products
Demonstrate a hands-on approach to work and willing to participate in ad-hoc projects on short notice

Qualifications, Skills & Education Requirements

Tertiary level degree ideally in Law, Political Science, International Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics.
Minimum 2-3 years of due diligence, professional services engagements or in similar report generation.
Ability to oversee and support other research analysts and monitor work of less experienced colleagues.
Leadership and management skills to oversee and manage projects effectively.
Excellent Research skills across all media; significant understanding of risk areas and compliance related items and the ability to explain these to other research analysts.
Ability to handle ad hoc research into new areas and bespoke research.
Knowledge of the following Systems/IT: Office products, internet searches, social media.
Timeliness: deliver reports on time and consistently.
Dedication and commitment to continual learning.
Client focused approach.
Highest levels of integrity and displays this regularly.
This is a WFH position based on the country where it is advertised.

Please submit your CV or Resume in English.

description:
About The Job

This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic and pivotal project in General Insurance as a Tester in the UAT team with a leading Insurance company in South Dublin. This is a temporary 9 month contract with an immediate start. You'll be working in a team for a key strategic project in General Insurance. The project is key to this organisation's digital strategy for Commercial Lines business.

You can expect to work on a range of different product types and with various teams and business areas within G.I and with external third party suppliers. Working with colleagues in both the business and in more technical teams to test requirements and to ensure systems are suitable for end users.

This is an excellent opportunity to learn new skills and expand your experience in a broad, vibrant and dynamic area.

What will you be doing?

Act as Test Analyst on key change initiatives ensuring compliance to test processes and quality standards.
Analyse business requirements and design tests to ensure that business requirements are met.
Contribute to definition of test approach.
Design test suites with comprehensive coverage.
Design and management of test data.
Produce detailed, accurate estimates.
Test execution to agreed service standards.
Defect investigation, resolution and management.
Providing detailed reports using Microsoft Excel.

3rd level degree (IT related)
At least 3 years experience in a test role.

Strong attention to detail is a must.
Analytical, technical knowledge and test design skills.
Excellent Excel skills essential. VBA scripting beneficial.

Experience in testing insurance documentation.
Experience of the software development project lifecycle.
Experience of JIRA and Zephyr desirable.
ISTQB foundation in software testing.

What will you get for this role?

A competitive market leading salary depending on skills, experience, and qualifications

Cycle to Work benefit scheme.

Family friendly parent's (matching paternity and maternity leave) and carer's leave.

A Company For Everyone

description:
Functieomschrijving

Ben jij een data-analist? En heb jij affiniteit met de publieke gezondheid en infectiebestrijding? Lees dan snel verder!

Wat bieden wij jou

Beloning in gemeenteschaal 9 trede 4
Tijdelijk dienstverband met uitzicht op vast
Werken voor Gemeente Den Haag
Werken op Westeinde 128
32 tot 36 uur werken Wie ben jij

Je hebt een klant- en resultaatgerichte aanpak, waarbij je planmatig en organisatorisch te werk gaat. Met een grote dosis aan overtuigende, adviserende vaardigheden neem je het team, collega's en klanten mee in de uitkomsten van je analyses. Niet alleen het talent om data te analyseren en te vertalen naar bruikbare informatie is hierin essentieel, maar ook de beschikking over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden om de informatie over te brengen. Collega's typeren jou als een nauwkeurige, flexibele medewerker die oog heeft voor de mensen om zich heen. Het werk vraagt om een proactieve houding en grote mate van nauwkeurigheid.

Minimaal 2 jaar aantoonbare relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in de publieke gezondheid en infectieziekten in het bijzonder;
Ervaring met het beheren en controleren van data uit diverse administratieve processen;
Ervaring met het verbeteren van processen en het data gedreven werken stimuleren;
Ervaring met het begeleiden en vertalen van de informatiebehoefte;
Ervaring met data-analyse en visualisatie;
Gevorderde kennis van PowerBI;
Kennis van HPZone;
Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Wat ga je doen

Je komt te werken binnen de afdeling Algemene Infectiebestrijding, maar werk je ook samen met collega's van andere afdelingen en de gemeente Den Haag. De afdeling maakt gebruik van diverse systemen, met daarin een veelvoud aan beschikbare data. Jij gaat met deze data aan de slag en weet dit om te zetten en te presenteren in begrijpelijke taal. Dit vraagt inzicht, een scherp analytisch vermogen en ruime ervaring. De data vertaal je naar dashboards en rapportages op basis van de behoefte van de afdeling die je hebt opgehaald. Ze dienen als input voor de surveillance en monitoring en zijn ondersteunend aan het beleid, financieel- en procesmanagement binnen de afdeling.

Je bent tevens een belangrijke adviseur op het gebied van de interne administratieve en algemene werkprocessen met als doel deze processen verder te optimaliseren. Waar nodig werk je nauw samen met onze softwareleveranciers, maar ook met andere samenwerkende organisaties. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor een optimaal gebruik van BI tools (waaronder gebruikersondersteuning). Aan jou de uitdaging het datagericht werken binnen de afdeling naar een hoger niveau te brengen. Kortgezegd: Jij helpt onze organisatie om nog beter en effici√´nter te kunnen opereren!

Waar ga je werken

Je gaat samenwerken met inhoudelijke experts, zoals artsen en verpleegkundigen. description:
What You Will Bring

We are looking for someone that has:

a good understanding and knowledge about the "laws of physics" in information technology, including an understanding of what is possible to accomplish in computer networks and systems, given different prerequisites.
experience with analysis of executable files and documents such as: PE files and/or JavaScript, Flash, Silverlight, PDF, Office documents, ELF and APK files.
experience with analysis of network traffic.
experience with or interest in technologies / software such as Snort, Suricata, Bro IDS (or other technologies for inspection and analysis of network traffic).
experience with or interest in technologies such as Yara (or other static malware analysis solutions).
experience with / interest in / desire to work with technologies such as Cuckoo, Joebox, Norman MAG, BlueCoat / Symantec MAA, FireEye AX, or experience with / interest in sandbox technologies. experience with / interest in / desire to work with software such as Volatility, Rekall (or memory analysis in general).
experience with / interest in / desire to work with software such as FTK, Encase, Sleuthkit, Log2timeline, Plaso (or traditional forensics in general).
experience with / interest in / desire to work with solutions such as Soltra, MISP or other platforms for information and data sharing. Relevant certifications

SANS Security certifications: SEC487, SEC503, SEC504, SEC505, SEC506, SEC511, SEC560, SEC599.
SANS Forensics certifications: FOR500, FOR508, FOR526, FOR572, FOR578, FOR610.

What We Can Offer

An informal and pleasant working environment that provides opportunities for growth, influence and variations in tasks
Competitive salary, share program and bonus scheme that promotes a long-term employment outlook, including attractive pension and insurance coverage
Opportunities for relevant professional training (courses) and conferences
We place a strong emphasis on workplace well-being and teambuilding through social activities, events and trips with colleagues. In addition, we have an inclusive environment that promotes work-life balance and accommodates to families. Both in Utrecht and Oslo our offices are centrally located. In Oslo, you'll find us at Solli plass.
A workplace that has been ranked as one of the best in Europe for a number of years. In Norway we have been amongst the top 10 workplaces for 10 years in a row. Last year, we even won our category!

How do I apply?

Email us at rekruttering-web@mnemonic.io and write "MSS-TI-Analyst" in the subject field. Add a text about why you are right for the job, and your CV. Send us a code project you have been working on, that illustrates exactly how you work with code.

If you have publications or projects you have worked on that you think represent your technical skills or ability to communicate, please attach or refer to these.

Background check

We use Semac AS for background checks in our recruitment process. Security clearance is a requirement.

At World Fuel Services, our employees are the key to our global success. We are industry leaders due to the innumerable talents of our approximately 5000 strong professional team. Our people thrive in an entrepreneurial and culturally-diverse environment, where innovative thinking, collaboration and efficient execution are highly valued. Our high-performance culture is what allows us to drive sustained growth. Stronger together, we promote an environment where individuals can thrive.

When you click 'Apply', you will need to click on 'Create Account'. By creating an account, you will be able to view your applications and their statuses. Your password must contain 1 upper case letter, 1 number, and 1 special character.

Please note that by submitting an employment application you consent to World Fuel Services processing your information for this role and potentially for future employment opportunities, in accordance with applicable laws. To learn more about how we protect and/or process personal information, please visit the WFS Privacy Center at: https://www.wfscorp.com/en/privacy-center.

Job Description

The Energy Data Analyst position supports the client interface with Kinect Energy, through multiple data platforms. Key responsibilities include data entry, processing and scanning of vendor invoices, data review and trend analysis. This position coordinates the communication and resolution of invoice discrepancies between the client, vendors, and Kinect Energy colleagues. This position requires ownership of various assigned supplemental activities that support the controls and processes needed for successful fulfillment of client requirements. You will be working in a fast paced, dynamic team-oriented environment.

Duties And Responsibilities

Ensure daily completion of all data entry processing of vendor invoices and usage data into Kinect Energy systems
Data review and needed resolution for all supply, pipeline and utility vendor invoices with assigned clients
Understand and be able to work within the Kinect Energy systems to produce client reports, as well as necessary back-up supporting documentation
Work within a data management team, distributing and contributing to the workload equally with team members
Effective use of current software and the willingness to be involved with beta testing, as needed
Communicate in a professional manner with verbal and written communications with all levels of employees, vendors, and clients
Coordinate with World Fuel Services personnel, suppliers, pipeline, and utilities to remedy errors discovered in a professional and timely manner
Quantify and report value to the Client Scorecard as incidents are remedied
An understanding of the energy contracts and complex energy invoices must be understood and analyzed
Requirements

Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal are essential
Strong analytical skills are essential
Strong IT skills are essential in windows-based application software such as Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint
Experience of processing high volume of data in an educational or work environment is essential
Knowledge and/or experience in the energy industry is desirable
Strong problem-solving, mathematical, and organizational skills are essential
Strong team working skills are essential
Bachelor‚Äôs degree is desirable

description:
We are looking for a passionate, certified CX Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

The data analyst responsibilities include conducting full customer lifecycle analysis to identify pain points and opportunities to improve the overall customer experience.

The data analyst will set up and manage the corporate Voice of the Customer platform, develop analysis and reporting capabilities.

She/he will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

The main data sources to use will be Salesforce Sales & Service cloud, customer feedback tools, Product Usage analytics, ‚Ä¶

Responsibilities

Collect data from Salesforce and other data sources and segment data for customer feedback gathering.
Manage the Voice of the Customer platform: set up and manage survey campaigns via several channels (e-mail, in-app, websites,).
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and determine the best way to represent it visually to managers and stakeholders by providing ongoing reports.
Monitor the integration with other systems & tools (Salesforce, Tableau,)
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing performance indicators to locate and correct customer data to ensure data quality.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

Ensure quality assurance and process documentation.

Define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), assess and determine the success of specific initiatives.

Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.

Requirements And Skills

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise with Voice of the Customer platforms (Qualtrics, Customer Gauge, Forsta, Medallia,‚Ä¶) is an asset
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

description:
About Us

Global Tech Markets‚Äô mission is to help organizations grow, evolve, and thrive. By integrating modern technology with the best people, we drive businesses forward in sustainable and smart ways. We do this by offering a range of specialist services, from which our partners can pick and choose depending on their needs.

Our range of expert services have been crafted to help businesses modernize and thrive at any point in their journey. Whether they‚Äôre just starting out and need a hand, or have a huge project in the pipeline, we‚Äôre here to guide them and do the heavy lifting where needed. Our range of services includes support, sales, VIP, CRM, Payments, Payouts, Anti-fraud, Risk Management, and more.

Our values center on providing our assistance in a friendly and human fashion, cutting out the corporate tape to deliver a practical and holistic service. We build trust, and value long-term partnerships that allow our customers, and our team to grow together.

As a member of the Payments Department, you will be responsible for creating periodic analysis and valuable insight into the performance of our Payment Providers. You will need to work collaboratively with the Payment Relationship Managers and Head of Payments to deliver analysis of partner performance, costs and KPI‚Äôs. Having a keen eye for detail and the ability to understand complex processing models is crucial for success in this role.

Your Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: responsible for analyzing, and interpreting, payment data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in payment behavior. This will involve working with data sets, running analyses, and creating visualizations to present findings.
Reporting: preparing and presenting reports on payment data to the relevant stakeholders in the organization. This will include summarizing findings, providing insights, and making recommendations for improving payment processes.
Process Improvement: work closely with the Payments Team to identify areas for process improvement. This will involve analyzing current processes, identifying inefficiencies, and recommending changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of payment processing.
User Flow Analysis: analyze the user flow of the payment process to identify weak points and areas for improvement. This will involve examining the user journey, from a payment process perspective from start to finish and identifying any issues related to payment providers, product issues, or traffic issues.

Your Profile:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science
Proficiency in using SQL and PowerBI
Experience with data analysis and working with payment data is required.
Understand card transaction and alternative payment methods end-to-end both from a business and data perspective.
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially with Excel and PowerPoint.
A minimum of 1 year working in the payments industry will be considered as an advantage.

Our reward to you is:
¬∑ Competitive salary package
¬∑ Transport allowance
¬∑ Food vouchers
¬∑ Birthday vouchers, newborn vouchers
¬∑ Health Insurance
¬∑ Happy hours filled with free drinks and snacks
¬∑ Multisport cards
¬∑ Friendly work environment with positive teammates
¬∑ Team-building activities
¬∑ Great office locations

Get on board, join the fun, send us your CV already! In English.

All applications will of course be treated in the strictest confidentiality. Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted!

description:
Bedrijfsomschrijving

Je bent onderdeel van het team Informatievoorziening en Automatisering (I&A) van de afdeling Financi√´n & Bedrijfsvoering. Dit team bestaat uit 6 collega‚Äôs waarvan er 2 werkzaam zijn als BI Specialist. Binnen dit team werk je samen aan projecten. Daarnaast heb je ook ieder je eigen verantwoordelijkheden.

Functieomschrijving

Als business intelligence specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het organisatie brede informatiebeheer en de informatievoorziening. Je bent gericht op het beheer en de kwaliteitsbewaking van het datamodel, het verzamelen van gegevens en het omzetten ervan in informatie. Je hebt een controlerende taak als het gaat om de kwaliteit van de gegevens.

De organisatie ori√´nteert zich op de implementatie van een nieuw ERP systeem. Het gebruik van verschillende data moet hiervoor opnieuw worden ingericht en dashboards moeten opnieuw worden gebouwd (Power BI). Jouw expertise is hierbij zeer welkom. Jij denkt mee over de te gebruiken data. Wat kunnen we nog meer met onze data doen? Welke behoefte is er? Welke data hebben we precies nodig en hoe zorgen we ervoor dat deze bruikbaar is? Het doel: de data op een goede manier gebruiken en daarmee stappen zetten naar een nog meer data gedreven organisatie.

Jouw Taken

Je draagt zorg voor de actualiteit van de documentatie voor het datamodel, gegevensdefinities, gegevensbeheer en rapportages en ontwikkelt documentatie, procedures en werkvoorschriften in lijn met de BISL methodiek
Je zorgt voor het implementeren van BI-projecten, onder andere op het gebied van ETL, DWH en data integratie
Je volgt wet- en regelgeving die betrekking hebben op de data
Je vertaalt wensen uit de organisatie naar geschikte BI oplossingen
Je zorgt voor het verder ontwikkelen, inrichten en onderhouden van de ETL-procedures en DWH-omgevingen
Je onderhoudt de ontwikkelde BI-producten
Je stelt procedures op voor het opschonen en verbeteren van data en focust hierbij op architectuur en datamodellen in bronsystemen en het datawarehouse
Je bouwt standaardrapportages en genereert managementinformatie
Je stelt het controleprotocol op en beheert deze
Je ondersteunt bij de aanschaf en/of vervaardiging van gebruikersdocumentatie en zorgt voor het actueel houden van de documentatie voor het datamodel, gegevensdefinities, gegevensbeheer en rapportages
Functie-eisen

HBO(+) werk- en denkniveau
inzicht in en ervaring met het verbeteren van I&A.
ervaring met het geven van uitwerking en implementatie van optimalisaties op het gebied van informatie- en datamanagement;
kennis van en ervaring met ETL, DWH en data integratie;
kennis van en ervaring met Microsoft SQL, SSIS, Visual studio en Power BI;
Ervaring met Dynamics Empire (pre)

Gaan jullie nat dit jaar samen verder, dan ontvang je een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.

Fashion und Lifestyle, 6.500 Mitarbeiter:innen, 13 Department Stores, Online-Shops in Deutschland, Polen, √ñsterreich, Belgien, Luxemburg, Spanien, den Niederlanden und der Schweiz, √ºber 2000 Marken, 25 Restaurants & Confiserien, 15 erstklassige Services, drei Friseur-Salons und stets ein besonderes Einkaufserlebnis ‚Äì das ist Breuninger. Ein Traditionsunternehmen, das internationale Wege geht, seine Ziele klar definiert und innovative M√∂glichkeiten schafft.

Du f√ºhrst explorative Datenanalysen durch & √ºberwachst die Shop Leistung, um Trends und Chancen f√ºr Produktverbesserungen basierend auf Kundenverhalten zu identifizieren

Dein Profil

Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt oder hast dein logisches Denken anderweitig geschult. Statistikkenntnisse, logisches Denken und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise erg√§nzen dein Profil optimal.

Du bekommst leuchtende Augen, wenn du erf√§hrst, dass unsere Analyst:innen mehr Daten zur Verf√ºgung haben als sie jemals analysieren k√∂nnen und schmei√üt nicht die Flinte ins Korn, nachdem du erkennst, dass sie nicht gelogen haben. Wir bieten

description:
Inventio is a fully integrated management services company that creates unique value for corporate entities and real estate assets. Inventio offers Sales & Acquisition Advisory Services, Asset Lifecycle Management, Ad hoc/OnDemand Solutions and Added Value Services to institutional investors, investment funds and private investors.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Financial Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for financial reporting, asset management, investment analysis, and ad hoc asset management tasks.
Ideally, we are looking for candidates with 1-3 years of experience and a background in a Big 4 accounting firm.

Responsibilities:
¬∑ Prepare financial reports and statements
¬∑ Conduct analysis and modeling of investment opportunities
¬∑ Monitor and manage the financial performance of portfolio companies
¬∑ Perform ad hoc financial analysis as required
¬∑ Work closely with senior team members to support investment decisions
¬∑ Conduct industry research and analysis to identify trends and opportunities
¬∑ Assist with the preparation of investor reports and presentations
¬∑ Participate in due diligence efforts for potential acquisitions

Qualifications:
¬∑ Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or related field
¬∑ 1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably from a Big 4 accounting firm
¬∑ Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large data sets
¬∑ Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
¬∑ Knowledge of financial modeling and valuation techniques
¬∑ Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
¬∑ Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently
¬∑ Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

We offer a competitive salary package and the opportunity to work with a highly regarded team of professionals. If you are a driven and ambitious Financial Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your career, we encourage you to apply.

description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world class Data Analyst to join our Regional team in Poland. The team is deployed in the top cities in Poland, leading our growth and working on delivering on our vision of giving everyone easy access to anything in every city in Poland.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Develop and own scalable and reliable reporting tools for the Regional team, enabling the team to make decisions based on up to date and insightful data with a 360 view, including commercial, operational and financial KPIs.
Support the definition of targets and calculation of achievements both for the team and for single individuals, ensuring fair but challenging targets.
Track KPIs, identifying trends and factors that represent risks and opportunities, across areas such as Sales, Marketing & Growth, Operations, Profitability.
Perform ad hoc analyses and deep dives as required, owning them end to end: frame problem, identify and gather data, perform analysis, present insights and results with appropriate visualizations.
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
You Have

At least 2 years of experience in an analytical role, working with data to generate insights and make the right decisions
Used to work with ETL processes and gather data from different sources (APIs, Excel and other databases)
Advanced worksheet / modeling skills
Expertise in SQL - Redshift experience a plus
Knowledge of visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, QlikView, etc..
Previous experience in Python and with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is a plus
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a scientific or business discipline
Proficiency in English (written and communication) is a must. Proficiency in Polish desired.
Based in Warsaw, Krak√≥w, ≈Å√≥d≈∫, Wroc≈Çaw, Gda≈Ñsk or Pozna≈Ñ
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits

Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
External learning tools
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo

Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

description:
Farm21 is looking for Data Specialist who likes to work in a highly dynamic Agritech startup. While we currently have a small team, we are active in 15 countries.

Our online platform provides farmers with advice and actions needed for optimal crop production. Through this advice, fewer resources are used to achieve better yields; more efficiency, better returns; higher sustainability. Data sources we use for this include our own field sensors but also weather forecasts, soil information, satellite images, etc. It is up to the Data Analyst to build the data analytics and find the connection within the data.

In addition, our ambitions go beyond large farms. In the coming years, we will also work on propositions for small farmers in developing countries. They are responsible for 80% of the food consumed in developing countries. We believe they must be part of the digitisation of agriculture to solve the world food crisis. We can help increase their yields, giving them a better income and the world more food.

As a data analyst, you can make a huge impact on the agriculture sector, globally!

This role allows you to work on an infinity of possibilities, but within one platform. At Farm21, you get the time and space for depth, but every project requires a different approach and data set to work with.

Tasks

Farm21 aims to generate insights for farmers based on data. We're continuously looking for more and better data to help farmers make better decisions. Your tasks will include:

Combining different data sources.
Refinement of (sensor) data, and identifying gaps in data.
Generate insights and visualize/ interpret data using machine learning/deep-learning models.

Requirements

You

Have experience or a strong interest in arable farming
Knowledge of biological (plant) processes
Are always curious about learning new stuff
Identify good-quality data sources

Responsibilities

Work together in a team to generate useful insights from data
Identify good-quality data sources
Identify missing data
Build, test and maintain data models
Implementation of data models in a production environment

Qualifications

Fluent in English
Experience in the agricultural sector
Bachelor's degree/level or higher

Bonus

Experience in crop growth modeling
Experience in SQL/PostgreSQL
Experience in Python

Benefits

We offer:

Fantastic colleagues to work with, a young and dynamic team
A good salary
Provided lunch at the office
The opportunity to work both remotely and in the office (Amsterdam)

Does this suit you? Then apply quickly!
linkedin_skills: PostgreSQL, SQL, Data Models, Data Engineering, Data Modeling, Data Science, Databases, and English

description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that's what we're doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we've still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

Right now, we have more than 20 million users around the world. We work across 8 countries and 90 cities, adapting our product fast to be leaders in all of those markets and taking care about sustainability.

Our Data teams include an eclectic bunch of awesome and diverse people from different backgrounds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries. Having a diverse and inclusive work environment is really important for us. That's why we like to count with different points of view in our team that help us to solve problems in a better way.

You will:

Leverage data to perform intensive analysis across all audiences of our business to improve operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Generate and execute on ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics
Use data visualization to distill complicated spatio-temporal data into easy to digest summaries that are used to monitor health and inform product
Present findings to senior management to guide business decisions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such Operations, Growth, and Tech

Our Ideal candidate has:

Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
Graduate degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, or related fields
Working experience as a Data Analyst or Operations Analyst
Working experience in execution process optimization, measurement and follow up on customer-centric processes based on scalability and continuous improvement
Proficient in writing and understanding SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma. Certificate will be a plus
Working knowledge of Tableau or any other data visualization tool
Master degree on Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related will be a plus
Good communication skills and priorities identification
Fluency in English and Spanish

What's it like to work at Cabify?

We're a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our high-performance.

Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-38K‚Ç¨], L3 [35-48K‚Ç¨]
Recharge day: Every 3rd Friday monthly off!
Hybrid Model
Flexible work environment & hours
Regular team events
Cabify staff free rides
Personal development programs based on our career paths
Training programs
Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare
All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent)
A pet room, so you don't have to leave your furry friend at home

Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability.

Join us!

description:
About the company:
NOOS Digital is an agency specialized in digital business development. We started the company with the idea of bridging the gap between executive management and operations in digital transformation and acceleration. We define our offer in strategy, analysis, and project management in order to improve our clients digital operations. Currently, we work on exciting assignments with Djerf Avenue, Sneakers n Stuff, Stadium, Scandinavian Photo.

NOOS strives to always be data-driven, insightful, goal-oriented, and innovative in our assignments. Our projects are delivered with dignity and we are passionate about creating long-term and sustainable growth for and together with our clients. Our ambition is to create an outstanding agency that is ub top level of the competition of what we do. For us, being the best means continuously challenging ourselves, our clients, and our projects to a level where we consistently exceed our clients expectations.

Read more about us atwww.noosdigital.com

About the position:
As a Data Analyst at NOOS, you will be a part of our Data and Insight Team and have the opportunity to help us develop our offering within Insight and Strategy. This makes you a central part of NOOS, where you work closely with our consultants to deliver the best results for our clients.

By nature, you are an analytical and structured profile who bridges the gap between business and technology in your analytical capabilities. You are skilled at translating data into insights and drawing conclusions from them. We place great importance on your ability to collaborate, flexibility and a solution-oriented mindset.

In your work, you will be challenged in various areas related to retail business development and digital transformation. We work from different perspectives depending on the customer and business we encounter. In this role, your responsibility, together with the team, will be to support projects of various natures from start to finish in close collaboration with the client.

Skills:

Strong Excel skills.
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics.
Knowledge or experience working in BI.
Skills in SQL, Python, Node.js.
Interpretation of large data sets.
Understanding of how we translate insights into recommendations.
An interest and curiosity in business development and business analysis.

Education:

Business Economics.
Industrial Economics.
Or equivalent academic education.

We offer:

The opportunity to be part of building tomorrow's management agency.
The opportunity to work with clients of different characters and with different challenges and conditions to create a successful digital business together.
Colleagues with a vast knowledge base in digital business and strong internal knowledge sharing.
Attractive benefits.
Office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary conditions (pension, wellness allowance, etc.).
Flexible work environment with the possibility to work partially remote.
Several company activities.

description:
AGCO is a global leader focused on the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery and infrastructure. As a Fortune 500 company and one of the global leaders in agricultural equipment manufacturing, we have an extensive network of over 9,200 dealers and serve more than 140 countries. While headquartered in Duluth, Georgia, AGCO has manufacturing facilities all over the world creating and distributing their full-line of products, including Challenger, Fendt, GSI, Massey Ferguson, and Valtra. Visit www.AGCOcorp.com for more information.

Financial Accountant / Analyst

Budapest, Hungary

We are looking for enthusiastic junior professionals to join our growing Financial Accountant/Analystteams in order to provide best class service to AGCO colleagues worldwide.

The junior financial accountant/analyst is responsible for the financial accountancy or analysis processes as part of the R2R organization in our Shared Service Center in Budapest and provides support for the entities under Budapest R2R team.

Your Impact

Completing month end close tasks within the agreed deadlines
Preparing accruals and posting them in SAP / OneStream
Analyze month end reports
Detect and notify unsuccessful payments. Assist to resolve unsuccessful payments.
Creation of manual payment instructions in several Bank Portals
Conducts data entry of accounting entries into the system and ensures data integrity

What You Will Bring

Bachelor degree in Finance or business (or similar)
0-2 years of relevant experience
Good MS Excel knowledge
Able to communicate in English

A Plus If You Have

SAP knowledge
Analytical skills
SSC reporting / GL accounting area experience
FASS/KPMG PBC List preparations experience

What We Offer

Working in international environment, possibility to grow global network
Additional benefits (Private medical insurance / Competetive cafeteria package / Employee assistance program, etc.)

If you are looking for an opportunity to work in an inspiring dynamic multinational environment for a leading global player of agricultural solutions, we look forward to receiving your application in English language (incl. your CV, motivation letter and earliest possible start date) via our career website: http://careers.agcocorp.com. For more information about AGCO, please visit www.AGCOcorp.com.

We offer you appropriate perspectives and personal as well as professional development possibilities

More people. More food. More farm productivity.

It's a simple but compelling growth opportunity for AGCO and for your career.

Join AGCO to grow your career. We are Leading the Way. Together.

AGCO - MAKE YOUR LIFE DIFFERENT

description:
We‚Äôre looking for the right candidate to join our Business Data Analyst team and become part of a fast-growing company that is on always on the look for people that will demonstrate they‚Äôre able to grow with the company. As the role is our entry level, this is a great entry point for a career path at Lokad, either as a future technical expert or as manager.

We help companies in different verticals (aerospace, automotive, ecommerce‚Ä¶) to forecast and make decisions about their inventory. The vast majority of our clients are based outside of France, mainly in North America and Europe.

As a Business Data Analyst (or Supply Chain Scientist in Lokad's terminology), your role is to make sure our clients get the most from Lokad's technology. The role is a mix between technology, data crunching and supply chain expertise. You will address complex supply chain issues and craft quantitative strategies. Your goal is not only to advise your clients on strategies to adopt, but to craft and execute these strategies on a daily basis while leveraging the data available as much as possible. Your goal is also to keep refining these strategies over time to keep them aligned with the needs of our clients.

At Lokad, you will benefit from the extensive training and coaching of our expert team. You will gain skills in supply chain, predictive analysis and overall quantitative optimization for business. You will learn how to achieve measurable business results grounded on scientific analysis of data.

About one quarter of your time is spent interacting with clients in order to better understand their business (mainly over the phone or by mail, with occasional travels). Note that, in order to benefit from your colleagues expertise, you won't be required to work on the customers' premises.

The rest of your time is spent on data analysis, including manipulating and cleaning data, setting up forecasts, economic optimization, reporting and data vizualisation. In order to do this, you'll learn to use our Differentiable Programming tools and a DSL (Envision) developped by Lokad.

We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualities:

A strong engineering background.
A keen interest in data and quantitative analysis in general.
Good Excel skills or programming skills (e.g. Python, VBA, SQL, etc.).
Impeccable command of English( French is optional).
Excellent communication skills and telephone manners.
A well-made head, rather than a well-filled head.We are not looking for someone who is already an expert in supply chain or programming. We‚Äôre looking for a fast learner, with an ability to quickly grasp technology and concepts, since our technology is by no means a simple and plug-and-play product. Knowledge or understanding of supply chain would be a bonus, but the ability to quickly assess and grasp a new situation or get a clear picture of how an organization works and what are the pain points is what we are really after.
Candidates must be self-motivated, confident and highly driven to achieve results with a ‚Äúhands on‚Äù attitude.

The role is predominantly office based, although some travel will be occasionally required to customers, partners or events. We are located in the very center of Paris, France (station Chevaleret).
linkedin_skills: Data Analysis, English, Python (Programming Language), Communication, Analytical Skills, Supply Chain Optimization, Programming, Supply Chain Management, and Customer Service

description:
Het zijn roerige tijden in de markt voor fusies en overnames; hoge inflatie, oplopende rentes en de nasleep van supply chain problematiek. Ondanks deze ontwikkelingen kan Catapult Corporate Finance de vraag naar haar diensten met moeite bijbenen. Daarom breiden wij ons team uit met onder meer (junior) business analysts.

Over Catapult Corporate Finance
Catapult Corporate Finance werkt voor opdrachtgevers die voor wezenlijke beslissingen in hun bedrijfsvoering staan. Of het nou gaat om gedeeltelijke of algehele verkoop van het bedrijf, de acquisitie van een concurrent, of het aantrekken van (groei)kapitaal; in al deze fases spelen de specialisten van Catapult een cruciale rol. Wij hebben een indrukwekkendtrack recordvan transacties in het hogere MKB-segment, in zowel binnen- als buitenland. Als processpecialist zijn wij werkzaam in vrijwel alle sectoren: productie (kunststof, staal, steen, hout), software/ICT, logistiek, handel, en alle denkbare vormen van dienstverlening.

De functie
Als (junior) business analyst verzamel je, al dan niet met een collega, relevante informatie en voer je (financi√´le) analyses uit. Je identificeert risico‚Äôs en kansen, komt met werkbare oplossingen en bijbehorende acties met tijdspad. In teamverband werk je doorgaans aan meerdere opdrachten tegelijk. Jouw functie is veelzijdig en varieert per opdracht, afhankelijk van de situatie van de klant en de rol die Catapult heeft.
Je maakt deel uit van het transactieteam. Je werkt aan waarderings- en financieringsvraagstukken, voert financi√´le analyses uit en stelt informatie- en financieringsmemoranda samen. Daarnaast ondersteun je het transactieproces, heb je contact met diverse partijen en ondersteun je het onderhandelingsteam. Je wordt aangemoedigd om initiatief te nemen en probleemoplossend te denken, met een gezonde dosis creativiteit.
Je bent vanaf het begin een integraal onderdeel van een overzichtelijk en hecht team, met een grote mate van vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Je verantwoordelijkheden nemen al snel toe en je zult direct en actief worden betrokken bij onder andere transacties, transities en financieringsvraagstukken.
De uiteenlopende situaties eisen proactief en zelfstandig handelen, niet zelden onder tijdsdruk. Je leert bij Catapult ‚Äòon the job‚Äô. Kortom, een unieke leerschool en een kickstart voor jouw carri√®re.
Aanvullend zul je na enige tijd de mogelijkheid krijgen om mee te werken aan een bedrijfsherstructurering of deel uitmaken van een turnaround team. Je ondersteunt jouw senior collega‚Äôs met (financi√´le) analyses op basis waarvan essenti√´le keuzes worden gemaakt.

Wie zoeken wij
Je bent een jonge professional met flair en eigenheid. Een autonome denker met verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en werklust. Een teamspeler met sterke financi√´le en analytische vaardigheden en een oplossingsgerichte instelling. Je bent proactief en hebt een scherp oog voor detail. Je begrijpt het belang van betrouwbare kwantitatieve en financi√´le inzichten, passend bij onze bijzonder hoge kwaliteitsnormen.
Je bent net afgestudeerd of je hebt net je eerste jaren relevante werkervaring opgedaan. Je hebt een Master degree in Finance, Economie, Econometrie, (Technische) Bedrijfskunde, Accounting of een andere vergelijkbare studie. Werk- en/of stage-ervaring binnen een corporate finance, private equity, transaction services of accountancy omgeving is een pr√©. Uitgebreide kennis van Excel is een must.
Je kiest bewust voor de unieke mogelijkheden die Catapult biedt. Je wilt aan transacties werken, en betrokken worden op de momenten dat je kunt leren van ervaren specialisten.
Ondernemerschap spreekt je aan en je bent ge√Ønteresseerd in wat mensen drijft. Je beschikt over uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden. Een flexibele instelling is een voorwaarde. Je bent bereid je in de breedte verder te ontwikkelen en de handen uit de mouwen te steken.

Wat biedt Catapult
Een unieke omgeving om de meest uiteenlopende bedrijfssituaties en sectoren te leren kennen. Een intensieve leerschool met steile leercurve, om door te groeien binnen Catapult of als basis voor een functie in het bedrijfsleven. Wij investeren volop in de ontwikkeling van het team. We verwachten dat je alle ruimte pakt.
Onze primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn meer dan marktconform. Daarnaast hechten wij veel aandacht aan persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling van onze teamleden.
Catapult kent een informele en betrokken cultuur. Wij werken vanuit ons prachtige pand aan de IJssel in Deventer.

description:
Job Introduction

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Culinary Data Assistantforan 18months FTCto join our central Food Platform team and help establish Sodexo as the culinary leader in the UK & Ireland marketplace. As the Culinary Data Assistant, you will play an integral role in the successful and consistent implementation of our Food Management System (FMS) through recipe and menu transfer, compliance management, and future development for core, retail, and segment requirements. You will work closely with the Culinary team and various stakeholders to ensure that the FMS is fully developed, deployed, and maintained within the agreed framework, while delivering excellence through the FMS.

To be successful in this role you will have great communication skills, be a highly motivated individual with a broad understanding of the catering industry and a sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles.

Come and be a part of our exciting journey towards culinary excellence and make a positive impact on our customers and clients. Apply now to join our team!

Role Responsibility

Transfer of data to the FMS in line with the DRIVE project strategy
Support the process for managing expectations to support segments
Ensure full collaboration with all teams impacted by role
Support the Co-ordination of alignment of recipe and menu development protocols and processes
Liaise with central and segment peer group to ensure all are fully aligned to FMS and Drive systems
Work inside the framework of best practice for culinary excellence when developing recipe and menu content
Fully support the culinary team to effectively test the robustness of all recipes and menus prior to launch
Liaise with design team, central culinary team and segment executive teams to execute briefs effectively
Establish strong working relations with all relevant stakeholders to ensure the most successful and effective use of the role

The Ideal Candidate

Highly motivated data inputter with a good level of catering experience in industry including system management
Experience in recipe and menu creation
Broad understanding and sound knowledge of different basic cookery principles
Computer literate and a good working knowledge of Food Management Systems
Strong self-motivational skills with proven track record of delivery to deadlines
The ability to interpret and translate new developments in a structured manner to ensure the project continues
Strong influencing and relationship building skills with wide range of stakeholders
Must be able to work with competing demands
Ability to manage a number of different projects at the same time including the allocation of resources as appropriate to deliver to timescales and deadlines
Strong listening and influencing skills with proven effectiveness in successfully working as part of a project team
Strong communication and rational decision making skills

Desirable

A background in recipe, menu, and concept design
Product development within various sectors
Proven track record in supporting the development of projects
SME Experience within a number of segments within foodservice/contract catering market
Development and Training background

About The Company

In the UK and Ireland, Sodexo employs around 30,000 people, and partners with clients in many sectors across business and industry; schools and universities; sports and leisure; energy and resources; government and agencies; healthcare; justice and defence.

Sodexo‚Äôs connected; people-centric approach brings together a diverse range of expertise. The breadth of services it offers ranges from food and hospitality; cleaning; reception; concierge ( Circles ); security; property management and technical services through to data driven workplace strategy and design ( Wx ); employee engagement and recognition services ( Sodexo Engage ) and personal home services through Prestige Nursing + Care and the Good Care Group.

Vital Spaces is Sodexo‚Äôs value proposition that puts people at the heart of everything we do, bringing together services and solutions and focusing on the productivity and wellbeing of people wherever they are.

Sodexo is committed to being an inclusive employer; we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds and identities.

We‚Äôre a Disability Confident Leader employer. We‚Äôre committed to changing attitudes towards disability, and making sure disabled people have the chance to fulfil their aspirations.

We are building on our support to the Armed Forces community through the development of specific pathways within our recruitment process to‚ÄØ support ex-forces personnel and reservists, those applying for jobs with us who meet the ideal candidate criteria for the role advertised are guaranteed to progress to the selection process

Sodexo

description:
12 Month Contract

Your team

The Paddy Power Sports Team is responsible for the overall revenue for the online Paddy Power Sports business. We are tasked with defining and ensuring consistent delivery of a customer led proposition to grow our share in the UK and Irish market.

This role will report to the Senior Performance & Analytics Manager, Paddy Power Sports. The overall purpose of the role is to provide insights to help grow the customer base of the Paddy Power online business via acquisition and retention.

What you‚Äôll do

Investigate, analyse and provide recommendations on key areas of customer lifecycle
Lead customer growth performance to understand growth drivers, trends and customer behaviours. Ensuring that the customer is central to our decision-making process.
Supporting strategic, deep dive analysis to drive recommendations on how we can better deliver against the PP customer growth strategy
Working with the Digital Acquisition team to manage and optimise digital media spend and updating partners on the performance of PP overall marketing spend
Evaluate and understand the drivers of all Sports revenue streams.
Show how customer experience and interactions impact performance.
Encourage a data led approach to the decision-making process across commercial team.

How you‚Äôll do it

Skilled at assimilating numerous sources of information to make or change decisions
Ability to prioritise and focus on what really matters and to communicate these decisions in a timely manner
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with ability to communicate effectively at all levels within the business
Strong personal presence and presentation; ability to feel comfortable when surrounded by senior partners and speak with confidence
Ability to build successful relationships and positively influence people ‚Äì including direct reports, peers and partners
Team player with personal characteristics that engender trust and confidence

About PaddyPower

Work that makes play jealous

Paddy Power has been breaking and re-writing the rules since 1988, from on-track bookmakers to cheeky upstart mischief-makers, to part of the largest betting and gaming technology company in the world.

Although we‚Äôve grown to the betting behemoth we are today, we‚Äôve not forgotten our roots. We continue to offer great value and entertainment to our customers and keep them at the heart of what we do.

Our culture of hard work, boldness and an innovative spirit got us to where we are and we take our work seriously, but not ourselves! We win by having the best people working well together. Don‚Äôt pigeon-hole us either ‚Äì our company is a mix of sports nuts, gaming innovators, tech geniuses, perceptive people-people, inspiring leaders‚Ä¶ and a very busy legal team.

We‚Äôve got a growing squad of specialists, and we make the work fun. Sound good? Maybe there‚Äôs a spot on the team for you!

Plus, PaddyPower is part of the Flutter UK & Ireland family ‚Äì a collection of big-hitting entertainment brands such as Betfair, Sky Betting & Gaming and Tombola.

What we‚Äôll offer you

¬£1,000 learning fund
Unlimited holiday
Twice-yearly bonus (with part of it guaranteed!)
Pension contribution scheme
Private healthcare
Flexible ways of working ‚Äì home or office, it‚Äôs your choice!
Access to thousands of Udemy courses
Invest via the Company Sharesave Scheme
16 hours paid volunteering time per year

We‚Äôre working to be an inclusive employer, and we encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking and working to apply. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don't have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.
If you need any adjustments to make this role work for you let us know, and we‚Äôll see how we can accommodate them

About Our Client

Our client is the driving force behind the recycling of household packaging in Belgium. Every day,they work with public and private partners to create a circular economy for household packaging, from collection among the general public to sustainable recycling in our own country.

Job Description

You have a central role in order to ensure right observations, conclusions and decisions across the business; from upstream (members, total market) to downstream operations (collection and recycling).

With a critical eye you contribute to various internal and external reports.
You provide our internal and external clients with actionable and easily interpretable reports and dashboards that support them in their decision making.
Through your knowledge and your insights in our data, you monitor and report on data quality.
You have a permanent view on external data which can help us enriching our own data.
You follow up your projects in an autonomous and efficient way.
As member of the Data Team, you help spread the data story throughout the organization so that data stays top of mind within the company

The Successful Applicant

you have a university degree (or equal by experience); with at least 5 years of work experience;
You have a profound knowledge of excel
You have a basic knowledge of applied statistics;
You have experience with BI reporting;
You speak fluent French or Dutch with a good knowledge of the other language.
You have an analytical mind, you work in an accurate and structured way;
You are a strong problem solver
you are a teamplayer
You are an autodidact

What's On Offer

Working in a company focusing on growth of their employees

Working with passionate team members

Working directly with top management

Competitive salary package

description:
This is the perfect opportunity if you have passion for Data, Analytics & E-commerce. You get enthusiastic about providing actionable insights to improve our users‚Äô experience & e-commerce performance. We are looking for 2(!) Data Analysts who will join us in our journey to become a truly data-driven e-commerce company. We work in agile product teams, where product owners, developers, data analysts, UX & CRO specialists are working closely together and fully focus on their product. With 3 E-commerce data analysts already in the team & a data analyst community of > 50 colleagues across the group, we‚Äôre sure you will get challenged to keep learning and look forward to your contribution!

During the last years we have spent a lot of time on the implementation of the Google Analytics 360 suite and Tableau. The implementation gives us great insights in our visitors & customers‚Äô digital behaviour. Think about what you can analyze and contribute to our business with access to all our click, customer, product- & sales data of >50k (recurring) customers, >500k products and >1 billion of yearly turnover data. We are looking for the person who is always looking for the question behind the question, can combine & extract data from multiple sources and is comfortable in translating these into actionable insights and presenting this to stakeholders.

The role

You will enable product teams to make decisions from the data lens, by conducting in-depth analysis and creating insights through dashboarding.
You will analyze and monitor the development of our e-commerce KPI‚Äôs, the progress of our objectives & key results (OKR‚Äôs) and translate these into insights.
Support multiple teams in working with OKR‚Äôs by defining metrics, baseline measurements & targets. Then validate & analyze the impact for all improvements we create in our digital experience (such as pre-post analysis and/or experimentation analysis).
Build relationships with stakeholders to establish yourself as the expert for data insights & web analytics expertise, working together with the other analysts in different teams to continuously improve our maturity in data-driven decision making.
You are responsible for our key journeys, such as findability of items, delivery communication & check-out. A very challenging opportunity!

Who are you?

Completed bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a relevant professional area.
At least 4 years of experience as an analyst in e-commerce/digital companies.
Good communication and advisory skills (written and spoken).
Strong experience with web analytics like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics or similar tooling.
Experience with dashboarding and data visualization.
Strong ability to extract actionable insights from advanced analyses and being able to advise on possible next steps.
Preferably you have experience with Python, SQL & Google BigQuery (we provide room for training & personal development to learn).
You live in the Netherlands, near Utrecht or Varsseveld, because we work at least once a week together at our office in Utrecht and also at our main office in Varsseveld.
Since the working language in our team is Dutch, we prefer candidates who are fluent in Dutch, both verbally and in writing.

What do we offer?

We are an ambitious, fast growing and financially sound organization. Therefore, you can expect a few important things from us. We value personal development a lot and thus we offer great budget for courses and trainings. Besides a competitive monthly salary we also offer:

37 holidays
A lot of room for growth and entrepreneurship
Profit sharing bonus scheme
Flexible working hours and location
Laptop and working from home package
Generous pension plan

Who are we?

Johan Kramp started in 1951 from his garage in Varsseveld. When cycling he crossed borders to Germany: the beginning of the international millions company we are nowadays. We still follow the principles of Johan Kramp, but in time of today. Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business.

Working at Kramp means working with more than 3.000 international colleagues. Despite our size, we retained our family culture. Colleagues describe our culture as warm, friendly and informal. Entrepreneurship is in our DNA, but it's allowed to make mistakes. Trust and responsibility is what our colleagues value in Kramp as their employer.

Procedure

In case you feel challenged by above role description and requirements, we‚Äôre interested in meeting you! Please use the application button and send your CV and motivation letter.

Location

Varsseveld (NL) / Utrecht (NL)

Contact

Do you have a question about this vacancy? Please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact Bob Veurman, Manager E-business Marketing.

E: bob.veurman@kramp.com

Varsseveld (NL)

Location:

Varsseveld (NL)
