description:
The Data Annotation Specialist is a key component in building the next generations of speech recognition by producing high quality transcriptions and contextual turns which train and improve Microsoft products and services. The Data Annotation Specialist will use native language skills and cultural knowledge to capture linguistic nuances with high fidelity. In this role you will be the foundation of the Microsoft teams responsible for driving machine learning and high AI technology, such as, AI assistance for people‚Äôs daily life, meeting captioning, and more. Join our team and use your background and expertise to continue delivering value to Microsoft.

Data Annotation Specialists

Use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data.
Go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency.
Perform quality evaluation of transcription and annotation results produced by different sources.
Collaborate with team members on day-to-day problem solving and projects assigned by managers.
Data Annotation Specialists will come across offensive, sensitive, or objectionable material and may be required to work with this type of content to help train our AI models for the protection of Microsoft‚Äôs customers.
Data Annotation Specialists are comfortable understanding data as it relates to :

Sentiment: The emotional intonation and other subjective implications behind keywords and phrases.
Intent: The human intent, or the user‚Äôs end goal, behind different statements.
Semantic: Understanding exactly what the meaning is behind what users are seeking
--

Microsoft Business Process Outsourcing and AI Operations (BPO & AIO) is responsible for the contracting, performance management, and continuous improvement execution activities for all outsourced global service providers supporting a wide range of business units within Microsoft. Our Mission is to be trusted advisors who anticipate and operationally execute on Business Process and opportunities delivering value to both Microsoft and our Customers.

If you love the pursuit of excellence and are inspired by the challenges that come through driving innovations that impact how the world lives, works and plays, then we invite you to learn more about Microsoft Operations - and the value we deliver across Microsoft and to our customers and partners. We offer unique opportunities to work on interesting global projects in an environment that appreciates diversity, focuses on talent development and recognizes and rewards great work.

We make doing business with Microsoft easy.

Job location: Lisbon, Portugal (on-site only)

Fluent speaker or equivalent experience of French, France
Responsibilities

Data Annotation Specialist‚Äôs use in house tools to transcribe and annotate data for various projects. A few examples may be providing transcription (text) for audio clips or annotating text or images to verify certain types of data; go through content (online and offline), extract information, provide needed information through tools with high accuracy and consistency; perform quality evaluation of transcription and annotation results produced by different sources; collaborate with team members on day-to-day problem solving and projects assigned by managers.

Data Annotation Specialists will come across offensive, sensitive, or objectionable material and may be required to work with this type of content to help train our AI models for the protection of Microsoft‚Äôs customers.

Business Program Planning and Design

Learns to perform program landscape research and analysis (e.g., internal and/or external market, sales, delivery), forecasting, and examine business trends (e.g., customer feedback and expectations) to identify audience size and program scope, and stay current, agile, and competitive. Learns the overall business goals, objectives, and strategies, and understands the short-term business priorities. Understands and identifies current program risks, impact, and mitigation plans under close guidance from senior team members.
Learns to identify internal opportunities to develop new programs and improve current ones. Learns to identify root problems (e.g., root-cause analysis), define the program strategy, gather program requirements, identify resource needs, create the project plan and targets, and work across teams to align on the plan of record. Begins to develop the expertise to improve operations of existing programs by helping applying industry methodology, define program issues, assess various scenarios, and select the optimal scenario to resolve issues.
Learns to work with cross-functional (e.g., organizational, product, business) stakeholders (e.g., Engineering, Marketing) to design programs from initiation to delivery. Learns to produce collateral (e.g., proposals, strategy walking deck, internal and external pitch content) to incorporate stakeholder needs and ensure the business objectives are met.
Learns how to track the success criteria and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]), such as quality, adoption, usage, impact, and effectiveness for the program.
Business Program Excellence and Execution

Learns to define and execute on landing and communication plans, such as the target audience(s) and communication strategy. Maintains the rhythm of business (ROB) during plan execution to ensure participants and stakeholders are communicating and responding according to the necessary cadence under close guidance from senior team members. Learns to work across teams (e.g., Landing, Design, Engineering, Supply Chain, Finance, Technical Program Management) to ensure all program requirements are understood and can be met.
Learns to evangelize the programs to stakeholders, partners, and customers to gain buy in. Leverages data and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]) to demonstrate the value of the program and show business impact under close guidance from senior team members. Learns to adapt communication style and storytelling strategy according to audience and business needs.
Business Program Management

Learns about project portfolios including the project plan, timelines, milestones, financial management, performance metrics, and resource needs for programs. Communicates the program status to relevant stakeholders and holds them accountable for following the established schedule, and risk mitigation plans and processes, under close guidance from senior team members.
Learns about mapping or how systems work and impact one another. Learns to work with other teams (e.g., Supply Chain, Engineering, Sales) to ensure program processes are executed efficiently.
Business Program Evaluation and Improvement

Learns to conduct cost-benefit analyses to examine performance to value drivers (e.g., profit and loss [P&L], return on investment [ROI]). Learns about monthly business review (MBR) and helps run rhythms regularly to identify what is working and what is not.
Learns to collect and evaluate success criteria and performance metrics (e.g., Objectives and Key Results [OKRs] and Key Performance Indicators [KPIs]), such as acquisition, usage, impact, effectiveness, and customer feedback, and uses scorecards and dashboards to monitor programs and ensure all activities align with business and program objectives. Learns to use data analytics (e.g., scenario analyses) to derive insights and training that help identify program risks and mitigation plans, as well as opportunities to streamline and optimize programs based on lessons learned.
Demonstrates the skills needed to help ensure buy in and adoption of the new program or change by others in the organization. Learns to develop the collateral required to enable key stakeholders and others to be on board. Learns of the training, reskilling, and mapping of individuals conducted in partnership with Human Resources (HR).
Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

High School diploma/ GED or equivalent work experience
Fluent in French, France ‚Äì both written and spoken
Troubleshooting experience, customer service, or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent work experience
In depth knowledge of required language pitch, tones, rhythm, intent, etc.
Linguistics or computational linguistic background
Experience in language technology including speech
Proficient in multiple required languages
Strong attention to detail
Strong computer skills
Relevant certifications
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

description:
Ga jij met ons de uitdaging aan om richting onze collega‚Äôs de juiste service en continu√Øteit te garanderen van onze applicaties? In de rol van Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van gegevens om bedrijfsbeslissingen te ondersteunen en te organiseren in PowerBI.

Werken als Data Analist bij Broekman Logistics

Broekman Logistics is een logistiek dienstverlener die wereldwijd actief is op het gebied van Forwarding & Shipping, Warehousing & Distribution en Breakbulk Terminals (onze business units). Wij ontwikkelen creatieve logistieke totaaloplossingen voor onze bestaande en nieuwe klanten in een Business to Business markt. Dit alles met een personal touch!

Broekman Information Technology & Services (BIT), ons IT bedrijf, is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van alle ICT gerelateerde diensten aan de business units van Broekman Logistics. Binnen BIT zorgt de afdeling Business Applications & Data voor hoogwaardige en kennisintensieve applicatieondersteuning en het aanbieden van een data warehouse. Een groot onderdeel is het opzetten en onderhouden van het data warehouse. Daarvoor is er recent een data team opgericht met een data developer en een project manager. Ter versterking van ons team zijn wij op zoek naar een data analist, die zich zal focussen op het onderhoud van het data warehouse en het verzamelen, analyseren en organiseren van gegevens.

Jouw profiel als Data Analist

Als Data Analist ben je gepassioneerd voor het ontwerpen en verbeteren van data-gedreven oplossingen. Dit doe je voor de interne stakeholders, het management en onze klanten. Ook specificeer je waar nodig user stories. Je prioriteert en test de issues om de missie en doelen te behalen. Hiervoor werk je in Azure. Vanuit Azure wordt data uit meerdere bronnen ontsloten en beschikbaar gesteld aan PowerBI. Deze informatie breng jij (visueel) zo in kaart dat het voor alle stakeholders duidelijk en overzichtelijk is.

De Belangrijkste Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten

Het verzamelen van gegevens uit verschillende bronnen, zoals databases en online bronnen;
Het organiseren van gegevens in een begrijpelijke en bruikbare indeling in PowerBI;
Het analyseren van gegevens met behulp van statistische methoden en tools;
Het interpreteren van gegevens en het identificeren van trends en patronen;
Het opstellen van rapporten en presentaties om bevindingen te communiceren aan het management en andere belanghebbenden;
Het aanbevelen van strategie√´n en acties op basis van de gegevensanalyse.
Vanuit de rol van data analist kan je doorgroeien naar data developer waarbij je verder kan zorgen voor het beschikbaar stellen en toetsen van de data.

Jouw profiel als Data Analist

Je bent iemand die energie krijgt van data om bedrijfsbeslissingen te ondersteunen.

Verder heb je‚Ä¶

Minimaal HBO niveau in de richting van IT;
Ervaring met Microsoft PowerBI en Azure. Ervaring met Azure Data Factory en SQL is een pre;
Kennis van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal (ook op IT technisch gebied).
Tot slot ben je in staat issues in te schatten op prioriteit en complexiteit en de juiste escalatieprocedure te volgen. Je hebt een klantvriendelijke, proactieve en resultaatgerichte instelling en bent daarbij analytisch sterk en probleemoplossend ingesteld.

Verder kijken?

Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Corn√© Rutten, Corporate Recruiter (06-83653194 of recruiter@werkenbijbroekmanlogistics.com).

description:
Who are we?

We want to improve the lives of our patients. That is our daily mission. Our pride is our 2,500 employees who supply millions of people with important medicines every day. Health needs a healthy environment, we are convinced of this and, as an environmental pioneer in the German pharmaceutical industry, we are making our German sites climate-neutral in 2021. And that's not all: we are represented in over 80 countries worldwide, the market leader in generics, home to Germany's best-known drug brand ratiopharm, and a leading manufacturer of biopharmaceuticals. In total, we offer a broad range of approximately 700 products. These include innovative drugs, generics and over-the-counter medicines.

In short, we are Teva and we are very proud of it!

If you tick like us and are someone who enjoys breaking new ground - then we would like to get to know you. Are you also passionate about global markets and technologies? And would you like to revolutionize the future of healthcare at a leading provider of generics and biopharmaceuticals? Fantastic! Then why not become part of our team!

Curious? Then take a look HERE and see how it is working at Teva Ulm.

A day with us in quality control

In your new role as a QC Analyst / Laboratory Technician (m/f/d) Quality Control, you will be working in an international team of experts and will be responsible for testing raw materials, bulk and finished products according to currently valid guidelines (GMP quality standards) and perform independent analyses according to existing test methods.

You support laboratory processes and changes and take over the equipment responsibility of analytical instruments.

The maintenance of data systems (column database, reference database), support in the processing of deviations, OOS events and EHS measures as well as collaboration in project-related working groups are also part of your responsibilities.

Who We Are Looking For

You are

a reliable person with high team spirit and self-motivation.
solution-oriented and enjoy working with complex analytical equipment.
responsible, you distinguish yourself by your structured way of working and you like to work in a team.
accurate and have a proper operation style.

‚Ä¶ ready to seek your next long-term opportunity in Ulm, Germany.

‚Ä¶ ready to learn and develop yourself further in a growing organization.

Have you

successfully completed vocational training as a chemical laboratory technician*, CTA*, PTA*, laboratory assistant* or comparable education?

‚Ä¶ pursued a bachelor's or even master's degree in chemistry and see your entrance into the pharmaceutical industry via the quality control department?

experience in analytical laboratories?
good computer skills, SAP and/ or LIMS knowledge? (Equipment software in general would be an advantage)
good knowledge of English, both written and spoken?

What We Offer

At Teva

we take care of your health (among other things through a company health management system, a company doctor, physiotherapy, sports activities and a company canteen)
you have time for your family (through our own company kindergarten and holiday camps for school children, as well as 30 days of vacation)
you can develop your potential to the fullest (through a comprehensive virtual training program)
your achievements are valued accordingly (e.g. through recognition and Senior-Leaders-Programs, as well as various company events)
we think together with you about your future (e.g. through a company pension scheme)
we will provide you with relocation support to help you settle in

Function

Quality

Reports To

Group Leader Quality Control

Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site

The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.

Teva‚Äôs Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment

Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws.

description:
Your Main Activities Are

Ensure the Global Markets revenues are published in time on a daily basis, both for front office estimates and actual validated revenues
Challenge the data received by Middle Office to ensure consistency of the Global Markets scope
Contribute to the distribution of revenues reports to diverse interlocutors and provide analysis and qualitative explanation
Contribute to the monthly closing every end of month with several issuances of revenues that implies the respect of a tight calendar with multiple contributions
Active collaboration with other Finance departments (Reporting, Transfer Pricing, Accounting Controls) and Back-Office areas to ensure consistency and reconciliation of data
Partnering with the business managers to define qualitative commentaries of the performance of Global Markets and ensure management needs is reached

Profile And Skills To Success

Engineering or Business school, University Graduate, Finance Degree
Experience in Finance within the Banking sector including audit and consultancy firms
English | Advanced
Performance Management
Capital Market activities knowledge
Effective analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills and capacity to interact with senior management
Reactivity & pragmatism
Self-starter and team player, able to work independently and collaboratively with various teams in a deadline-focused environment
Excel (including VBA basics and core functions as Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, SUMIF) and Access

Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is a leader in the Eurozone, and a prominent international banking institution with strong roots in Europe's banking history. It has a presence in 65 countries, with around 190 000 Employees ‚Äì including more than 145 000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

Since 1985, BNP Paribas was one of the first foreign banks to operate in the country. Today, the Group has around 7.100 employees across several entities operating directly in the territory, offering a wide range of integrated financial solutions to support its clients and their businesses.

International reach

BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

Thanks to its international presence and regular and close collaboration among its different entities, BNP Paribas has the resources to support all clients with financing, investment, savings and protection solutions that help make their projects a success.

Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

description:
Keyline is a family-owned business headquartered in Conegliano Veneto, Italy. The company is a leading manufacturer of keys, key cutting machines, transponders and smart access solutions with 160 employees globally. With 9 subsidiaries in 3 continents the company is present in approximately 70 countries.

Keyline is part of the Bianchi 1770 Group (ABG Holding) and has inherited the centuries of experience in the key industry that has been passed down through the family since 1770.

About the role:

This role is responsible for managing projects within the IT team, as well as the evolutionary maintenance of tools and processes already in use, in an international context.

What we are looking for:

We are looking for a highly motivated individual with passion for Business Intelligence and Data Analytics. This person must exhibit exceptional leadership and management abilities, enjoy working on a team, and demonstrate critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

What you'll do:

Design and implementation of corporate data strategy.
Implementation of the Data Warehouse & Business Intelligence architecture.
Identification, implementation and management of data integration needs between different company systems.
Work with all business departments to gather and meet information needs by developing decision support systems and valuable insights.
Defining and implementing Data Governance and Data Management rules that ensure compliance with policies and regulations and make it possible to ensure data quality and consistency between the various departments and company systems, maintaining an adequate level of access to data.
Manage Data Integration, Data Preparation and Data Modeling activities and implementation of Business Glossary and Data Catalog, Lineage and Metadata management solutions.

Knowledge, skills and abilities:

An understanding of business dynamics
Proficiency in the English language
Excellent reaction and interaction skills with colleagues
Excellent ability to analyze and listen, as well as a strong disposition to working in teams to accomplish outlined objectives
Flexibility, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Dynamism, marked leadership skills, and flexibility complete the profile

Minimum Qualifications:

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics
5+ years' experience in the data/analytics field in consulting firms or data-intensive companies.
Experience in Data Warehouse, Data Hub, Data Lake construction projects.
Experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (i.e. Snowflake)
Experience with SQL Oracle and MySql databases and NoSQL databases.
Experience with structured and semi-structured data and in relational and non-relational data modeling.
Experience with Data Visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik).
Experience with ETL/ELT tools, Data Integration tools and platforms, Change Data Capture tools (eg Qlik Replicate, MuleSoft).
Knowledge of the main Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and Cloud architectures (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).
Availability to travel

Preferred Qualifications:

Manufacturing Industry experience
Knowledge in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.
SCRUM Agile/Kanban experience

What we are offering and benefits:

Competitive salary and career growth plan
Keyline community to support you daily to achieve an optimal level of productivity, wellbeing, and satisfaction with your life at work
Positive company culture and mentorship from experienced collaborators
Opportunity for travel
Continuing education and language courses
Flexible work schedule
Employee bonuses and benefits

Keyline provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Keyline complies with applicable regional and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

description:
Five9 provides businesses reliable, scalable, and secure cloud contact center software designed to create exceptional customer experiences, increase agent productivity, and deliver tangible business results.

We are driven by a passion to transform contact centers into customer engagement centers of excellence. Since 2001, Five9 has led the cloud revolution in contact centers, helping organizations transition from legacy premise-based solutions to the cloud.

We are looking for a Data Analystwho specialises in utilising the Looker data platform to create reports and visualisations. This role's main responsibility will be to develop robust, interactive, and visually engaging reports and visualisations to be integrated into our cloud solution for end users. They will also ensure data accuracy and system optimisation, contributing to the usability and efficiency of our end-user application.

Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and improve data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, and dashboards using Looker.
Transform raw data into comprehensible visualisations and reports that will be served directly in our end user application.
Design and create engaging, user-friendly dashboards and data visualisations for our end user application.
Collaborate closely with the product team to ensure the alignment of the data visualisation with the end-user requirements.
Maintain data systems and databases, including fixing coding errors and other data-related problems.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and troubleshooting.
Optimize system performance to ensure efficient data processing and reporting.
Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in a data analyst role, or a similar position, is required.
Proficiency with Looker is required.
Experience with SQL and other data manipulation languages.
Demonstrable experience with data visualisation and reporting.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Nice-to-have

Interest or experience in Data Engineering.
Familiarity with Google BigQuery.
Experience in data mining, data cleaning, and data management.
Previous experience in the Contact Center industry.
Benefits

Five9 Shares
Bonus Scheme
10% Flex Benefits
Meal Allowance
Medical Insurance
Life Insurance
25 day Annual Leave + Public Holidays
Five9 embraces diversity and is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.‚ÄØ The more inclusive we are, the better we are.‚ÄØ Five9 is an equal opportunity employer.

View our privacy policy https://www.five9.com/pt-pt/legal.

California residents, view our Privacy Notice here: https://www.five9.com/legal/candidatenoticeca.

Our headquarters are located in the San Francisco Bay Area with global hubs in the United Kingdom, Germany, Philippines, Portugal, and Australia.

description:
BayWa r.e.
Arabellastra√üe 4, 81925, Munich, Germany
Fulltime

At BayWa r.e.we r.e.think energy - how it is produced, stored and can be best used to enable the global renewable energy transition that is essential to the future of our planet. Based in 30 countries, BayWa r.e.is a leading global renewable energy developer, service provider, distributor and energy solutions provider. Operating throughout Europe, the Americas and Asia-Pacific, we are strategically investing in emerging markets around the world, actively shaping the future of energy and taking a stand against climate change. Embracing equity and diversity, we are committed to creating inclusive environments where everyone can reach their full potential. Every day, we are working hard to find new solutions, push technological boundaries and redefine service standards to make renewable energy even better.

About The Role

Due to our dynamic growth, we are currently looking for a Financial Analyst (m/f/d)to join our global Analytics & Business Intelligence Team and to support the group top management with financial planning decisions while playing a key role in enhancing our internal tools and procedures on business planning and valuation.

This position is preferably located in our company‚Äôs head office in Munich, keeping in mind that mobile working is part of our DNA.

What You Will Do

You will model, develop, update and own the group‚Äôs consolidated financial business plan, collaborating with the Business Entities, Treasury, and Finance and Controlling departments, working directly with BayWa r.e.‚Äôs top management
You will present and discuss the results of the business plan modelling regularly at top management level
You will evaluate projects and business development activities around the globe in terms of cost and value, fostering best practices with models and analysis tools

Your Profile

You have 3-4 years of experience with financial modelling as an analyst at an auditing firm, a corporate finance consultancy or comparable position, preferably in renewable energy
You have an excellent degree in a numerical subject such as Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or similar with finance-related aspects
You have very strong MS Excel skills
You are a self-motivated and enthusiastic team player with a getting-things-done mindset, willing to provide support to all colleagues
You are proactive and committed to improve tools and innovate procedures
You are a good communicator and well-versed in conveying insights to top management
Your very structured way of working, strong reasoning skills and good command of English complete your profile

What We Offer You

Mobile working
Flexible working hours
Modern office atmosphere
Company restaurant / Barista bar
Discounted Conditions Fitness
Discounted Online Shopping
Smartphone, also for private use
JobRad

Contact

We look forward to your application!

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion matter to us

At BayWa r.e. we cherish the diversity of our people and are dedicated to providing an inclusive environment of mutual respect. We aim to create equal opportunities for all applicants and colleagues.

We welcome everyone and do not discriminate based on origin, religion, social, cultural, or ethnic background, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

If you have any questions about the job offer, please get in contact with us.

Yasmine Haroun
International Recruiter

description:
BNP Paribas EMEA Finance employs 500 employees, of which more than 325 are based in Madrid. We manage more than 250 BNP Paribas entities from all over Europe, covering +60% of Group‚Äôs balance sheet and all group‚Äôs banking activities (Corporate & Investment Banking, Retail Banking, Personal Finance and other financial services activities‚Ä¶).

Our mission is to measure, control and explain all the financial indicators required to monitor accounting, tax, regulatory, liquidity, credit risk reporting and management result activities.

Mission

Client Performance Management teamis responsible of monitoring and consolidating figures from all Business Lines (CIB and Retail Banking & Services) at client level in order to generate Coverage reports, special reports for due diligence and m√©tiers teams, and even a full recap of the total revenues situation for Top Management.

Responsibilities

Ensure global consolidation and analysis of Management Accounting figures by clients (worldwide view) as well as other KPI‚Äôs (CVC, RAROC) in line with BNP Paribas standards.
Provide CIB Management and Group Finance with an in-depth analysis of CIB and Non CIB data (explanation of variations, normalization of the results to isolate one-off items) in order for the Group to communicate adequately monthly and quarterly results and for CIB Management and Coverage community to take strategic decisions of 3 Regions.
Elaborate and delivery on time the reports to Group Finance, CIB Management and Coverage members.
Perform a central reconciliation between Client and Business Lines reported figures.
Analyze and understand the results reported by the local/regional finance departments in order to ensure the quality and completeness of the data published in our Coverage reports.
Contribution to various studies to support business monitoring and decision making: ad-hoc analysis, reporting reengineering, specific projects related to clients scope, etc.
Coordinate Actual / Forecast / Budget reporting for the 3 Regions, prepare instructions, define timelines and ensure efficiency of the data chain process.
Projects, Systems Support, Operational Process Improvements

Requirements

University degree in finance & accounting, economics or comparable background
Experience: 0-2 years of experience in a Banking/Accounting/Finance/Audit environment is mandatory
Languages: ENGLISH C1

Skills

Attention to detail/rigour
Ability to synthetize/simplify
Ability to deliver/Results driven

Benefits

Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%)
31 vacation days"

Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Ben jij (bijna) klaar met je studie, heb jij een passie voor werken met data en ben je klaar voor een vliegende start van je carri√®re? Lees dan snel verder!

Als data specialist ben jij bezig met het verzamelen, verwerken en controleren van data. Je hoeft hier nog geen ervaring in te hebben, want wij leiden jou, betaald, op tot data analist! Dit doen we door je een opleiding aan te bieden, maar ook een plek om te werken zodat je jouw geleerde kennis direct in de praktijk kan uitoefenen. Je wordt vanaf dag 1 betaald!

Tijdens deze training word jij opgeleid tot volledig professional. Je behaalt erkende certificaten die goed staan op je cv. Agreena is an exciting, dynamic and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to drive impact for farmers and the climate. Agricultural Data Collection

ENGLISH BELOW

Hummingbird Technologies and Agreena are seeking part-time agricultural data collection contractors across Lithuania to help with in-field data collection as part of ongoing sustainability projects tracking regenerative agricultural practices in agrifood supply chains.

Responsibilities:

Travelling to local designated areas of interest and collecting information including which crop is being grown and the level of farming intensity

Following a simple protocol to document the required type data per field

Logging the information for each field on a mobile device using an easy to use app.

Contact with the farmers is not required as the data is collected from the roadside

Uploading data daily.

Requirements:

Travel may be required to farms in your assigned region, which will be determined based on your geographic location

An iPhone/Android phone or tablet to run our data collection app

A valid driver‚Äôs licence

Your own car to travel to the assigned location

Experience working in agriculture to a level where you can reliably and confidently identify major crops and the type and intensity of tillage performed.

Timeline:

This work will take place from January 2022 to May 2023

The work is flexible to your schedule as you choose the number of hours and when you work but a minimum of 8 hours per week availability is preferred

Salary:

Employment is contract based

Payment will be made per data point collected

The average payment for a full day of data collection (8 hours collecting) is 100-150 Euro plus the expenses listed below:

Lunch is covered at a rate of 6 Euro per full 8 hour day

Mileage is covered at a set rate for EU countries at 0.23 Euro per Km

If you would like to be part of this exciting project with the ultimate goal of rewarding farmers for regenerative and sustainable agricultural practices then please either apply via LinkedIn or send your CV to data-operations@agreena.com

description:
Vous avez dit Frichti ?

En 2015, Julia et Quentin se lancent dans la folle aventure Frichti pour rendre lebien manger accessible √† tous. L'histoire commence avec la livraison de plats cuisin√©s maison √† base de produits frais. Finis les sushis hors de prix, les pizzas surgel√©es et les frigos vides, Frichti a permis aux parisiens de changer leurs habitudes en proposant une offre diversifi√©e et abordable : des plats cuisin√©s maison par nos chefs, des produits frais de saison ainsi que des partenariats avec les plus cool et talentueux chefs du moment ü§©

Depuis 2015 Frichti a bien grandi, la FrichTeam est pass√©e de 2 √† plus de 500 Frichtiens ambitieux qui r√™vent de continuer de conqu√©rir les fronti√®res ! Aujourd'hui nous sommes pr√©sents sur Paris mais aussi en r√©gion √† Lille, Lyon, Grenoble, Aix, Bordeaux, Nantes.

Notre offre Frichti at Work propose deux formules √† nos clients : une 100% digitale - la Cantine 2.0 et une en physique avec l'installation d'un kiosque chez notre partenaire - la Cafet' Frichti .

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ? ‚ö°

Chez Frichti, nous partageons le m√™me go√ªt de l'ambition. Tu aimes le challenge, avoir des responsabilit√©s et un impact fort ? Alors rejoins-nous !

Chez nous, tu auras l'opportunit√© d'avoir un impact visible et imm√©diat sur le d√©veloppement de Frichti et sur la vie de nos clients.

description:
Sportnco Group is one of the leading sports betting and gaming solutions providers in the online gambling industry. We focus on producing the best iGaming & Sports Betting solutions for our clients so that they can grow and develop across regulated markets worldwide. Now, Sportnco belongs to the GIG group. Gaming Innovation Group is a leading iGaming & Sports Betting technology company, providing solutions, products, and services to Sports Betting & iGaming Operators. Founded in 2012, GiG operates out of Malta and is dual listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol GIG and on Nasdaq Stockholm under the ticker symbol GIGSEK.

We are passionate about our work, and we have pleasure in making our work our great passion, proud of our great collaborative culture and work environment. We are looking for professionals who are eager to learn and work as a team, committed and positive, to join our multidisciplinary team. To support this strong growth which continues into 2023, SPORTNCO is hiring to grow.

We are looking for a QA Analyst to strengthen our established product team

Main responsibilities:

Contribute to the definition and implementation of full functional testing strategies and plans on all Sportnco's projects including new deliveries and product development
Functional / User-Acceptance Testing on all Sportnco's projects to ensure quality and conformity of deliverables with requirements
Work closely with product owners to contribute to and challenge features and user stories
Report and track defects & fixes in close collaboration with the rest of the Sportsbook development team
QA sign off on all releases
Other duties:

Continuous platforms' monitoring to identify improvements proposition and bug reporting
Permanent technology and best-practices intelligence
Client operational support when required
Required skills:

Previous experience as QA analyst within an Agile environment is a big plus
Rigor and great personal management
Excellent communication skill
Knowledge in SDLC & projects management softwares (JIRA Software and Service Desk)
Team player, with ability to work autonomously
Ability to share knowledge
Knowledge of the online gambling industry, and more specifically sports betting, is a big plus
Fluent English is a must, Spanish is a plus

description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced QC Analyst to join a global pharmaceutical company based in Cork. If you are a highly motivated QC Analyst with a passion for ensuring product quality and compliance in the global pharmaceutical industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Responsibilities

Testing, review and disposition of pharmaceutical DSs, Intermediates, cleaning samples, investigatory samples, In Process Control (IPC) samples and/or raw materials in accordance with Corporate procedures and in compliance with the current GMP standards.
Carry out testing of DSs, Intermediates, cleaning samples, investigatory samples, cleanrooms, IPC samples and/or raw materials in accordance with the valid testing procedures and regulatory requirements.
Ensure that laboratory equipment is well maintained and calibrations are performed at the designated frequencies.
Review results generated by other analysts for compliance with requirements.
Ensure correct data entry to the current Laboratory Information Management System - SAP
Carry out method transfers and participate in the validation of analytical test methods as required.
Write and maintain necessary documentation (test protocols, SOPs, instrumentation manuals and templates / checkout sheets, method transfer reports, OOS reports, etc) according to the existing SOPs and cGMP standards.

Requirements

BSc in Scientific discipline
1-2 years minimum work experience in the pharmaceutical industry
Preferable to have experience in analytical testing techniques such as (HPLC, GC, UV, wet chemistry, dissolution, etc.)
Professional requirements: familiarity with current Good Manufacturing Practices and sound knowledge of analytical technologies.

description:
The Role

We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst. In this role you will undertake data analysis to help ensure our customers are playing sustainably and in a safe environment.

You will support initiatives related to fraud prevention, AML, KYC, detecting early signs of problematic gambling and optimising the effectiveness of our responsible gambling tools and processes.

At Kindred we see challenges as an opportunity to do something in a better way, both personally and professionally. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society.

Kindred's ambition is to reach 0% revenue from harmful gambling by 2023. Our success is built on trust; we trust each other to deliver on our promises and believe giving ownership and responsibility at all levels is the way to make the right choices for Kindred and our customers.

What You Will Do

Undertake ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Deliver actionable insights to inform data driven decisions.
Liaise with stakeholders to understand business goals and identify analysis projects that support these goals.
Communicate findings of analysis throughout the business.
Assist Senior Data Analysts with the delivery of larger complex projects.
Improve constantly on your technical & soft skills.

Your Experience

A record of turning data insights into actionable solutions.
Experience with SQL, R, Python, or similar.
Experience of data analysis in a high data volume business.
Knowledge of fraud prevention, AML, or responsible gambling would be an advantage.
Degree preferred in computer science, statistics, economics, or other math/science related field.

We are also looking for someone that:

is solution oriented, curious, humble, and resilient.
has strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
has meticulous attention to detail.
has a strong work ethic.
has excellent interpersonal skills.

What do we offer?

‚ö° A great team with passionate analysts and engineers.

üåç Work hard / play hard office consisting of 60+ nationalities within a Mediterranean culture, in an English-speaking environment.

üåÜ Awesome offices with ergonomic desks, pool and table tennis tables, VR area, yoga area, subsidised lunch, daily fresh fruit, and gorgeous panoramic sea views.

üõ´ 24 days paid vacation plus bank holidays.

üå≥ 3 days CSR leave.

üìà Employee share plan.

üìó Training budget, conferences, access to LinkedIn Learnings and mentoring programmes.

‚öïÔ∏è Private medical insurance and free eye test.

üë∂ Enhanced maternity, paternity, and shared parental leave.

üö≤ ‚Ç¨500 Wellbeing allowance per year.

üí± Up to 8% matched pension contributions.

üè° Flexible working including up to 6 weeks detached working.

üíº Occasional travel to other Kindred Group offices including Stockholm, London, Gibraltar & Madrid.

‚òï Meetups and calendar of social events in the office; quarterly team outings.

description:
About us:

Amach Software is an industry-leading technology driven company with headquarters located in Dublin and remote teams in UK and Europe.

Our blended teams of local and nearshore talent are optimised to deliver a cost efficient, high quality and collaborative solution.

Established in 2013, we specialise in digital transformation including agile software development, DevOps, automation, cloud consulting, data and machine learning.

We are seeking a highly motivated and data-driven individual to join our customer's Global Contact Centre team. You will be reporting into the Data & Insights Manager and play a critical role in driving business decisions through data analysis, visualisations and insights.

Please note this is a 4-month contract.

Required Skills:

2+ years of experience in a data analysis role, with a focus on customer experience
Strong SQL and/or Python skills (Python desired, but not required), with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or QlikView
Strong analytical skills, with a passion for solving complex problems through data
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations and proven strength in storytelling with data

Desirable skills:

A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
Knowledge of AWS Connect system beneficial

Key responsibilities & duties include:

Utilise SQL and/or Python to extract, clean and analyse large datasets from various sources
Design, develop and implement data visualisations to effectively communicate complex data insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key business questions and provide actionable insights to support decision making
Monitor and analyse key performance metrics to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for improvement
Develop and maintain data dashboards, reports and tools to enable self-service analytics
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis and visualisation techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights

What's in it for you:

An opportunity to join a fast-growing company
Options for career advancement
Learning and development opportunities
Flexible working environment
Competitive rates based on experience

Not for you?

Check out all of our open positions in our careers pageand follow us on LinkedInand Twitterfor future opportunities.

P.S. Share this with friends and co-workers! Don't be afraid they'll steal it from you, if you're amazing and smart we'll find a role for you. We are growing fast and are always looking for talented people.

At Amach, we strive to be an inclusive community of open-minded individuals with different backgrounds and we are committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion. We strongly believe that a diversity of experience and background is essential to create a fulfilling environment and better solutions for our people and our customers. All Amach employees and contractors are expected to honour this policy and act to ensure that every individual is respected in the workplace.

description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with nine distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,600 hotels in operation and under development in 120 countries. The Group‚Äôs overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos.

People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment, and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.

DESCRIPTION:

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will play an instrumental role to deliver meaningful business insights to various business groups within Radisson. You will support the business partner and develop a good understanding of business needs and business objectives and define appropriate ways to turn data into actionable insights.

Supported by the rest of the Business Intelligence function, you will support business stakeholders by doing detailed analysis, deliver initial insights and design/develop PowerBI reports and dashboards.

This position will report to the BI Business Partners and will work closely with the key members of the business areas.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create and deliver insights to end-users, with a strong focus on actionable data.
Support the BI Business Partner and develop a deep understanding of various business functions. Identify how data can provide actionable answers to key business questions.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and use storytelling techniques to showcase prototypes and demonstrate possibilities.
Implement data reporting solutions, including creating and maintaining BI reports and dashboards, improving data quality and automation, and prototyping new reports and BI solutions.
Ensure the correct implementation of the corporate BI strategy.
Provide coaching and training to end-users on the effective use of BI tools.

REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a similar position.
Extensive expertise in developing reports in Power BI, including visual design, data transformations, and optimizations.
Knowledge of database concepts, relational databases (e.g., Azure Synapse, MySQL, SQL Server), and data exploitation techniques (including SQL).
Background and/or experience in predictive modeling and (descriptive) machine learning on the Microsoft stack is desired but not mandatory. Familiarity with other Microsoft Power Platform applications is a plus.
Proficiency in data analysis and data management, including business requirement engineering and basic project management.
English proficiency. Fluency in Spanish is an advantage.

"Radisson Hotel Group is a leading hospitality company serving as a true host and best partner to guests, owners, business partners and talent. Our eight unique hotel brands offer award-winning and exceptional hotel experiences, originating from our strong Scandinavian heritage of design and innovation. Our brands embody our modern vision of hospitality, including authentic local tastes, stylish living design, unique locations and vibrant social scenes.

Radisson Hotel Group brings a refreshed commitment to hospitality leadership to meet the changing travel industry and the bespoke needs of our guests. We provide exceptional service in all of our hotels across the globe and strive to deliver a hospitality experience that is beyond guest expectations."

CAREERS

As one of the world‚Äôs largest hotel companies, we are always looking for great people to join our team. If this sounds like an ambition you share, then start with us.

description:
Van leuk werk, komt goed werk!

Whooz is onbetwist marktleider en dat willen we graag blijven. Onze medewerkers hebben veel kennis en ervaring, zijn innovatief, hebben grote ambities en vooral veel plezier. Ons team bestaat uit enthousiaste medewerkers, die met elkaar zorgen dat we onze klanten n√≥g beter, effici√´nter en daadkrachtiger kunnen helpen met het bereiken van hun doelen.

Whooz koestert een informele en nieuwsgierige cultuur waar mensen oprecht blij worden van data. Van leuk werk, komt goed werk, nietwaar? En als dit werk tot nieuwe toepasbare inzichten leidt, worden we al helemaal vrolijk. Dat verveelt nooit en dat merken we elke dag.

Puzzelen met data
De toepassing staat voorop
Zelfstandig in een team
Jezelf ontwikkelen door onze dienstverlening te ontwikkelen
Eigenwijs
Hybride werken
#WhoozLovingData

DATA ANALIST ‚Äì startersfunctie

Kom jij net van hogeschool of universiteit en heb je zin om in de praktijk echt met data aan de slag te gaan, dan hebben we voor jou de juiste functie! Bij Whooz helpen we in een team met specialisten elke dag onze klanten om met data antwoorden te geven op marketing- en locatievraagstukken.

Dus puzzel jij graag met veel data en cre√´er je graag waarde voor onze klanten door data om te zetten naar inzichten? Dan ben jij wellicht degene die we zoeken.

Wat we bieden is een mooie functie waarbij je data bewerkt en analyseert om vervolgens waardevolle inzichten te cre√´ren voor onze klanten. Niet de data, de tool of de methodologie staat voorop, maar de toepassing van de klant! Stap voor stap begeleiden we jou op een informele manier, zodat je leert hoe jouw analytische skills waarde brengen aan de hand van concrete vraagstukken binnen klantanalyse, -werving en -behoud.

Al snel voer je in het team van analisten zelfstandig en in teamverband analyses uit voor onze opdrachtgevers. Daarnaast doe je dataleveringen aan licentieklanten en ondersteun je onze klanten in het vinden van waarde in data. Je bent nauwkeurig en analytisch en vindt het leuk om concreet aan de slag te zijn met data en klanten.

We snappen dat je wellicht nog niet 100% weet wat je wil voor de rest van de carri√®re en daarom is er binnen Whooz altijd ruimte om aan de hand van je interesse en/of nieuwe vragen uit de markt nieuwe technieken te proberen en nieuwe toepassingen te ontwikkelen. Bijvoorbeeld door een nieuwe manier en/of vorm te bedenken waarop we inzichten generen voor onze klanten of door mee te werken aan de ontwikkeling van een nieuw product.

Het allerbelangrijkste voor ons is dat je echt enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en dat je altijd nieuwsgierig bent naar nieuwe inzichten. Aangezien veel van onze klanten werken in het marketingveld is het fijn als je affiniteit hebt met (online) marketingtoepassingen. Vanzelfsprekend ben je veel met data in de weer, maar je schroomt niet om aan de klant je gevonden inzichten te presenteren, je advies toe te lichten en proactief met hem mee te denken.

Wat bieden we

Onze medewerkers vinden het fijn dat er een informele sfeer en open cultuur heerst binnen Whooz, waarbij we binnen het team samen de klant helpen en onze doelen behalen. Ook is er altijd ruimte voor eigen inzicht en idee√´n. Ben je een beetje eigenwijs? Helemaal goed want dat zijn wij ook. We bieden een marktconform salaris en bieden je ruimte om je binnen je werk te ontwikkelen. De meeste dagen werken we met elkaar op ons ruime kantoor nabij het centrum van Den Haag, maar er is zeker ook ruimte en flexibiliteit om een deel van de dagen thuis te werken.

Functie-eisen

Naast dat iemand met HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau zoeken, vinden we het belangrijkste voor deze functie is, dat je iedere keer weer enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en de mogelijkheden die deze bieden voor organisaties. Vanzelfsprekend is het wenselijk dat je beschikt over analytische vaardigheden (statistiek, clustering, modellering, dashboarding) en datamanagement vaardigheden (dataprocessen inrichten en runnen). Kennis van het toepassen van technieken, zoals web scraping en artifici√´le intelligentie, voor het verzamelen en genereren van data is een pr√©. Je bent daarnaast servicegericht, professioneel, zelfbewust, communicatief vaardig en kunt zelfstandig, maar ook samen werken. Voor communicatie met onze klanten is een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal een must.

Ben jij de oplossingsgerichte dataliefhebber die wij zoeken? Neem dan contact met ons op. Je kunt je motivatie en CV sturen naar info@whooz.nl t.a.v. Peter.

We zien bij Whooz absoluut de toegevoegde waarde van recruiters in sommige wervingstrajecten. Acquisitie en benadering door recruiters op basis van deze vacature wordt echter niet op prijs gesteld!

description:
Meet the CFO & EV Enterprise Analytics Team

A new era of digital transformation is being driven by the emergence of cutting-edge technologies. Companies use data analytics to accelerate their operations, make better decisions and provide higher quality service to their customers. To leverage the potential of data and maximize the benefits of a data-driven strategy, companies are looking for experts that are ready to define new standards and guide them towards success. That is where the Enterprise Analytics practice at Accenture comes in. We combine data analytics and strategy consulting as part of a single agenda which helps our clients solve complex problems, discover new opportunities and thrive in today‚Äôs global business environment.

What will you do?

Although no two days at Accenture are the same, as a Data & Analytics Analystin our CFO&EV Enterprise Analytics practice, typical tasks will include:

Design and development of cutting-edge, innovative, powerful reporting and analytics solutions

Advise on state-of-the-art reporting, including preparation of proof of concepts

Work directly with clients to gather specifications for data and report requirements

Effectively translate end-user reporting requirements into functional design documents

Explore large datasets, execute data preparation and data blending procedures, and create data models/sets, reports and dashboards

Improvement of existing solutions to ensure consistency and cohesiveness across all data analytics applications

Participate in strategic cross-domain projects that require analytics and business acumen

Participate in large-scale digital transformation programs working with international teams and collaborating with the brightest minds across many industries.

Who and what we are looking for?

Minimum bachelor‚Äôs degree preferably in finance and/or computer science

Sound knowledge of financial controlling aspects, enterprise performance management and financial analytics

Working knowledge in the area of SAP

Familiarity with design and implementation of reporting & analytics solutions

Familiarity and/or willingness to work with modern, market-leading technologies: SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP BW, SAP S/4HANA

Data savvy, ability to integrate data to create new insights

Problem-solving and out-of-the-box thinking ability, directed at defining innovative solutions

Strong communication skills: ability to explain solutions verbally and in writing

English at professional level, additional proficiency in German or French is highly welcomed.

Working Conditions:

Employment contract (Umowa o pracƒô)

Headquarter in Warsaw with offices in Cracow, Wroclaw or Lodz.

Due to COVID-19 global situation we are delivering our work remotely. Knowing that our Capability Network model is based on traveling and serving advisory working closely with our Clients, willingness and ability to work at client‚Äôs locations mostly across Europe, but also other locations, for short or long term is still required if pandemic situation will change.

What we offer:

Challenging job in a dynamic, professional, international and multicultural environment

Opportunity to gain exceptional on Polish market, skills, knowledge and experience gained on large scale international projects

The unique chance to work in a global network using only state-of-the-art tools and technologies

One of a kind experience with best know-how, with broad access to certifications and professional industry-recognized trainings.

Very attractive and competitive salary as well as a well-defined career path shaped to the individuals career focus & priorities

Attractive benefits package: Remote/Hybrid way of work, Cafeteria System, Multisport card, Lunch card, Private medical care, Employee Assistance Program, 100% paid sick leave, AMEX Gold Card, Lounge Club Priority Pass, Life insurance, Employee referral program and much more‚Ä¶

If this sounds like the ideal role, career, and company for you, please apply online as soon as possible.

Accentureis a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.

We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

‚ÄúAcross the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.‚Äù ‚Äì Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO

Capability Networkis a Global Strategy & Consulting practice, pulling together multinational and cross-cultural professionals based at key locations around the world. No matter what business, no matter where in the world, our unrivaled industry and function experts help our Clients to shape the future creating clearly defined, measurable value. We are delivering on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Our Poland Capability Network is located in Warsaw, Krakow, Wroclaw, Lodz. Your impact will be truly global as you will leverage an unmatched network of people, knowledge, tools and technologies and work alongside some of the best thinkers in the market.

‚ÄúJoin our world class capabilities and experience unique opportunities to grow your skills with us.‚Äù ‚Äì Ma≈Çgorzata Nasi≈Çowska, Accenture Capability Network Lead for Poland

description:
About PSC Biotech

Who we are?

PSC Biotech is a leading Biotech Consultancy firm founded in 1996, headquartered in Pomona, California, USA, with Global operations in Ireland, India, Singapore, Australia and the US, serving 350 clients in more than 23 countries worldwide. We provide cloud-based software solutions for Quality Management and Regulatory Inspections, pharmaceuticals contract manufacturing professionals, and metrology services to our clients.

‚ÄòTake your Career to a new Level‚Äô

PSC Biotech disrupts the conventional consultancy model by aligning our EVP as one of the unique selling point which includes the opportunity to work with the most talented cohort of like-minded professionals operating in the Pharma/ Biotech Industry. We offer a permanent contract of employment giving exposure of working in Top Pharmaceutical client sites in a diverse-cultural work setting.

Employee Value Proposition

Employees are the ‚Äúheartbeat‚Äù of PSC Biotech, we provide unparalleled empowering career development though Learning & Development in-house training mentorship through constant guidance to facilitate career progression. We believe in creating high performing teams that can exceed our client‚Äôs expectations with regards to quality of all scalable and business unit deliverables, staying under budget and ensuring timelines for our deliverables are being met.

Responsibilities:

Support the group genotyping operations through timely and accurate completion of assigned data analysis projects.
Clean, transform or model data using appropriate software for analysis and report generation.
Carry out livestock breed, traceability, parentage and other relationship analysis testing using molecular genotyping data.
Perform meat DNA traceability using bespoke DNA traceback system.
Interpret data and analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in the datasets.
Follow standard operating procedures, to perform quality control review of the data.
Help form part of the design and implementation of new programs and processes across the business as required.
Leverage prior analysis and programming experience to locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Participate in code review and program testing for existing and new processes.
Communicate progress and non-conformities to line management.
Resolve problems by examining and evaluating data; selecting corrective steps.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.
Enhance laboratory and organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to the role.
Perform other technical duties appropriate to the role as assigned by the Division Head.
Report any Health and Safety issues.
Adhere to ISO 17025 requirements.
Other duties as required.

Requirements

Experience, Knowledge and Skills:

Technically focused with strong analytical and quantitative aptitude.
Experience in molecular biology.
Knowledge of statistics and technical expertise in data analysis methodologies.
Detailed functional knowledge and expertise of data collection methods, data analysis, data integrity, and report preparation.
Demonstrated knowledge in MS Excel and R / Python programming.
Experience with dashboard report building (Power BI / Tableau) an advantage
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to compare data outcomes for concordance and perform quality assurance.
Familiar with working in a quality assured environment.
Ability to work independently, under pressure and to tight deadlines.
Ability to take ownership and responsibility.
Familiarity with ISO quality systems.
Good time management skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English

Qualifications:

Masters Degree in Biological/Computer science or Engineering.

description:
Together let's make ITALY great again, my client is seeking a highly motivated Renewable Financial Analyst to join their team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for renewable energy and a strong background in financial analysis.

About Company: Italian Developer, already operating for close to 3 years they have very ambitious growth plans, only apply if you want to be challenged and make a real change!

The ideal candidate should be passionate about finance, technology, innovation and renewables as a whole, to help make the

'switch' for a more sustainable future and longer lasting planet.

The Role

Our finance team is looking for a highly motivated financial analyst who has interest in joining a high performing team to drive company forward on its journey to a clean energy future. The individual will be responsible for supporting project finance and conducting financial analyses of all projects.

Develop financial models and providing financial forecasts
Be responsible for the project finance model and ad hoc amendments
Prepare monthly financial reports that monitor cash flow, identify trends in spending
Analyse project costs and preparing estimates for new projects
Work with management to develop budgets and forecast future revenue and expenses
Report to and work closely with the CFO
Work closely with the Development team
Assess and report on project returns and profitability
Maintain transaction data books for projects
Verify project inputs in financial models with the Development team and analysis of market conditions
Help prepare presentations at key milestones in project lifecycle
Provide analytical support to various groups internally
Closely follow industry trends and competitors
Other ad-hoc tasks as they arise

Requirements

Excellent knowledge of Excel and proven ability to navigate and manipulate Excel based financial models
Experience with statistical analysis and financial forecasting
Attention to detail and the ability to identify data patterns
Good verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of renewable energy or energy project finance (a plus)
Knowledge of Excel (required) and VBA coding (a plus)
Able to work autonomously and as part of a team
Fluent in English, proficient in Italian

Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor's degree, ideally in finance or a quantitative field
Proven experience in similar role
Understanding of principles of finance

Location:Milan

Salary:¬£30,000 TO ¬£40,000 euros per annum

This is a great opportunity to join an expanding business in the renewable energy sector in a strategically important position for the company

If like me you feel passionately about the fight for climate change and moving towards a zero-carbon world then reach out to me: d.ogunsola@ewi-group.com

ewi is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. ewi is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

description:
Why SoftwareOne?

About Goatpath

Goatpath is SoftwareONE‚Äôs software team that builds platforms and products to automate and govern customers‚Äô software and cloud investments through intuitive products they love to use. We are humble, nimble, focused, always ready to do what‚Äôs right, not afraid to take the toughest and unmarked path ‚Äì this is what Goatpath stands for. Within Goatpath there are currently four product groups: Marketplace, Cloud, Digital and Insights. Marketplace aims to redefine/revolutionize how software is bought, managed, and sold, while Cloud seeks to build the most simple and intelligent cloud management platform. Insights will allow customers to benchmark their maturity in the space of spend and technology, while Digital will revolutionize how customers will interact with SoftwareONE. All products are built on a shared platform.

The role

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer with experience in SQL, ETL pipelines and data warehousing. The ideal candidate should have a very strong ability in data modelling and be comfortable working with large and varied data sets. They should be able to create secure and flexible systems and model data for output through a variety of means including the use of report visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop data models for business intelligence and analytics
Build and maintain ETL pipelines and data warehousing solutions
Source, manage and integrate data from SQL and NoSQL databases, APIs, and other sources
Work with large and varied data sets, including structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data
Develop and maintain secure and flexible OLAP systems for analysis & self-serve reporting
Design and implement data visualizations and dashboards using tools like Power BI
Optimize data processing code for performance and reliability
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to provide high-quality data for analysis and decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation, cleansing and enrichment processes.

What We Need To See From You

Experience in data engineering/business intelligence development, with a proven track record of designing and implementing data pipelines and data storage solutions.
Advanced knowledge of Azure, including Databricks, Azure Data Factory and Azure SQL.
Familiarity with NoSQL technologies like MongoDB or CosmosDB.
Knowledge of data governance, data security, and regulatory compliance.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, or C# is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Being part of SoftwareONE means we live and breathe our company‚Äôs core values, most of all ‚ÄúCustomer Focus‚Äù and ‚ÄúSpeed‚Äù. But being part of the Goatpath team is a little more than that. Every single day we ask ourselves and our team members to:

Be curious, try things out! If you fail, that‚Äôs ok ‚Äì we don‚Äôt blame
Embrace change and start with ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù instead of ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù
Prioritize good over perfect ‚Äì don‚Äôt withhold customers from functionality
Leave the ego and office politics at the door
Take ownership
‚Ä¶.. and have fun!

Job Function

Goatpath

description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The Future Is What We Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our Global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

By changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Make the Best You.

Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. All our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Join us and Make an Impact.

We have an opportunity for a Finance Analyst to join our CORPteam in Bucharest.As Senior financial analyst you shall be a valuable business partner, ensuring value creation and support the PPE GBE.

Finance Analyst Responsibilities

Drive, review and back up for month close processes by ensuring the entity‚Äôs financial transactions are properly accounted for and correctly reported through HFM on a US GAAP basis, in accordance with Honeywell accounting policies.; f.e. monthly accruals, booking and reconciliation of sales between HSPE and Commissioner, allocation by LOB in HSPE and reconcile with COGS commissioner, timely preparation of Journal Vouchers, determine and submit I/C recharges, follow-up and drive resolution of any issues related to month close activities.
Partnership with Controllership and COTA to ensure operational efficiencies and transparency and timing of financial results.
Ensure accurate and Timely booking of I/C recharges in conjunction with controllership
Understand any balance sheet exposures and ensure inclusion in forecasts and outlooks
Calculate monthly accruals as required to ensure accurate financials
Owns and maintain the SOP (standard Operating Procedures) for the Country activities
Other accounting and finance duties where required; f.e. provide codding to AP team for external/I/C invoices, liaise with COTA / Controllership / Regional and global Finance Centre
Producing reports that enable continuous measurement and optimization of all key aspects of the business
Proactively identifying, communicating, and reporting P&L and balance sheet exposure mattersParticipate in the AOP/Forecast cycles
Partner with SBG Controllers to address in-country legal entity change management needs, including acquisitions, divestitures, site closures and core business processes migrations.
Qualifications

Bachelor Degree ‚Äì Finance/Accounting, Business Administration and others
Fluent English writing & speaking skills required
Knowledge of SAP and Hyperion, use of Business Object
Advanced use of MS Office, especially Excel (but also Access)
We Offer

Medical plan
Budget for flexible benefit scheme which can be used for travel, sports, dental scheme, and others
Business Travel Accident Insurance
Voluntary defined contributory pension plan
Meal allowance
A culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation
Market specific training and on-going personal development
If this is your dream role, then we'd love to hear from you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Additional Information
