description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.

Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow's communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.

Who we are:

The world's #1 caller ID and spam blocking service for Android and iOS.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv and Nairobi.
Listed On Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap

We at the Cloud Telephony team,are on a mission to enable AI-powered communication solutions for consumers and businesses through the Truecaller platform. The team will focus on creating cutting-edge cloud telephony solutions for consumers. The features the team will develop will affect the experience of hundreds of millions of users around the world directly, and will improve their daily interaction with their phone.

As a Data Analystin the Cloud telephony team, you will build the dashboards which the team uses to analyze how the users are utilizing the Assistant feature.

What Do We Expect From You

4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis (experience working for a Product oriented company is a plus)
Expertise in data visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSens,Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Experience using SQL to extract, transform and analyze data
Ability to communicate results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills

What Will You Work On

Identify different sources and types of information from the different app stores, internal analytics, Campaign management tools, AB test solutions.
Collect, clean, organize, analyze and interpret application data and usage, draw insightful conclusions to enable data-driven product enhancements
Create visual interpretations of data on Data Studio or Looker, produce graphs and charts with insightful notes and summaries
Analyze customer data and assist product development in finding new innovative ways to optimize conversion and retention
Support the management in identifying, measuring and following up on key metrics
Analyze campaigns and user journey results in order to improve conversion and retention tactics
Provide regular, accurate and comprehensive statistical reports
Provide objective insight and analysis to influence decision making
Keep up to date knowledge on external market and data research to compare our metrics and create a value-added analysis

It would be great if you also have

Worked with Campaign management tools and metrics
Good understanding of A/B experiments and hands-on experience is a plus.
Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python and R programming language

Life at Truecaller -Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:

A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance and pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: For the days you're working from home, we provide you with an attractive budget for creating your cozy office at home.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun at our playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!

Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

description:
Trustpair is reinventing B2B payment security.

We are building the leading anti-fraud solution for large corporations to help them avoid $20 billion in fraud every year.

With Trustpair, finance teams work with accurate data to avoid the risk of fraud and proceed to payments with peace of mind.

Trustpair is the best-in-breed product against B2B payment fraud and it must stay this way! Today a market-leader, Trustpair aggregates more data sources than its competitors and leverages on a bigger amount of payment data, making an intelligent use of the data collected.

Your role :

Integrated into the Data Team with 1 experienced Data Analyst, 1 experienced Data Engineer and a Data PM, reporting to our VP Operations, you will build and deliver a Data Analysis roadmap helping Trustpair‚Äôs management and teams take the best strategic and operational decisions.

You'll collaborate with all teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, Product‚Ä¶) in the company to help them define and track their key performance indicators, as well as identify compelling insights to enhance operational and business performance.

In the long run, you will be a key contributor in fostering a data-driven culture and mindset across all Trustpair teams, and optimizing the use of internal data to improve the performance of our solution.

Your next challenges & main missions:

Design and deliver our data analysis roadmap

Work with management and internal teams to identify Business Intelligence priorities and design a clear company-wide Analytics roadmap
Roll out the roadmap by leading focused projects with various teams (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Operations, Product‚Ä¶), understanding their business needs, designing efficient data marts and delivering impactful visualisations (Looker) to help them take the best decisions

Foster a data-driven culture and empower business users

Make business, operations & product teams more autonomous by designing dedicated data marts, making data more accessible to them and training them to build self-serve data visualisations (Looker)
Support these teams on advanced business intelligence and exploratory analysis projects
Contribute to shaping Trustpair‚Äôs Data Team‚Äôs processes, organisation and tools, and rolling out data best practices

Why join Trustpair? A list of our perks here!

Required skills & experience:

2 years of Data Analyst experience, ideally in a startup/scaleup environment
Strong SQL skills and experience with BI / Visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar)
Analytical, structured and result-oriented mindset
Ability to simultaneously manage several projects and collaborate/communicate with any type of stakeholder (Product & Engineering, Customer Success, Operations, etc.)
Dynamism and ability to adapt to new challenges
Knowledge of programming languages (Python), software engineering skills, familiarity with dbt and Looker are a plus

Recruitment Process:

Call with A√Øcha, our Talent Partner (30 min)
Experience interview with Cyrille, VP Operations (1h)
Case study (should take around 2 hours of work on a 1 week timeframe) & restitution
Coffee fit & meet one of our co-founders

Equal Opportunity Statement

Trustpair's policy is to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.

Applicants for all positions in Trustpair must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for or be a citizen from Schengen / EU zone. The verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

description:
Ref. 99459 ‚Äì Financial Analyst (m/w/d)

NOTHING RUNS LIKE A DEERE!

Welcome to John Deere, the leading innovator of agricultural, forestry, construction, lawn and grounds care equipment supported by comprehensive parts and financial services solutions. With 79.225 employees worldwide, we develop and produce connected and technologically advanced machines with a total sale of $52,56 billion. By joining us you grow individually and become a key contributor in managing the biggest global challenge: supplying 8,03 billion people with food, clothing and infrastructure.

John Deere Walldorf GmbH & Co. KG serves as our Sales & Marketing competence center for Europe, North Africa, Middle East and CIS and counts about 400 employees who support our dealers to deliver the best possible service to our customers.

Our department Controlling is looking for a

Financial Analyst (m/w/d)

Our experienced controlling team optimizes financial processes, analyzes and interprets data to make substantiated business decisions. Through precise budgeting and risk management, we offer a valuable contribution to increasing the efficiency and sustainable financial performance of the company. Join our Controlling team and let's make the big leap forward!

What You‚Äôll Get:

an attractive compensation package including variable pay program
competitive pension, holidays, life cover/income protection benefits
flexible working solutions to balance family and career
development and learning opportunities to support current needs and future aspirations

Your Responsibilities:

Contribute to the Financial Forecast and Product Line reporting preparation for the Walldorf entities (John Deere Walldorf GmbH & Co. KG and John Deere Walldorf International GmbH). This includes the branch business for the French, Spanish, German, International and Polish Agricultural markets
Act as business counselor for dedicated stakeholders in the Walldorf organization to support budget management and financial goals achievements
Collaborate with the Financial Shared Services for the month-end closing activities and internal control for the Walldorf entity
Support the projects impacting the Walldorf legal entity structure
Support the Financial Analysis Process for the European Branches to provide valuable Financial counseling to the European branches‚Äô stakeholders
Be proactive in Financial process optimization for the European branches

What Skills You Need:

Successful completion of studies in finance, economy, business administration or similar
Significant experience in Financial reporting and Financial analysis.
Negotiation skills and the ability to develop strong‚ÄØworking relationships
Commercial and business awareness. Knowledge of the branch business is a plus.
Ability to work in a diverse and international environment
Fluent in both English and German
Knowledge in US GAAP
Ability to stick to time constraints

This tariff position is based in Walldorf and vacant as soon as possible.

End of Posting:June/26/2023

No matter who you are - you are welcome at John Deere! We firmly believe that diversity and inclusion make us even stronger. If you can identify yourself with this - then we look forward to receiving your online application in English language!

John Deere Walldorf

Human Resources

Sophie Jardot

Additional Information:

To process applications, we use our online platform at our John Deere career page. We are not able to process applications through e-mail or post and ask for your understanding. Please complete the online application form, if you want to apply for a position at John Deere.

If you have any questions about your application, please contact: RecruitingGermany@JohnDeere.com .

description:
Cashpoint Malta Ltd.
We are one of the leading international sports betting providers and are a constantly expanding company in the entertainment industry.

We are the perfect team for you to join. We are constantly expanding and are involved in a fast-moving environment. We are open-minded and believe in open communication. We are anything but normal. And it‚Äôs been this way since 1996.

description:
About Us

We are Quadcode, a company that develops a SaaS trading platform for clients around the world.
We are currently looking for an Antifraud Analystto join our Market Making department. As an Antifraud Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team's efforts to combat fraudulent activities.

Your responsibilities will include:

Fraud Analysis: Conducting technical, financial, and behavioral pattern analysis to identify potential fraudulent activities on the platform.
Monitoring Trading Activity: Proactively monitoring trading activity to detect any anomalies or adverse patterns that may indicate fraudulent behavior.
Anti-fraud Measures: Developing and implementing anti-fraud measures by creating effective anti-fraud rules and assessing their effectiveness in reducing fraudulent incidents.
Fraud Detection: Staying updated on new fraud mechanics and proposing innovative ideas to mitigate emerging fraudulent practices.
Internal Tool Improvement: Collaborating in the continuous improvement process of internal anti-fraud tools and mechanisms, contributing to enhancing their efficiency and effectiveness.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Finance, or a related discipline.
Previous experience in fraud analysis, risk management, or a similar role within the financial/gambling/gaming industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify patterns and anomalies in data
Knowledge of financial and technical aspects related to fraud analysis
Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques
Understanding of machine learning concepts and their application in fraud detection
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Effective communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python programming and data analysis libraries.
Familiarity with Jupyter Notebook for data exploration and analysis.

We offer

relocation opportunity to Cyprus after a trial period;
remote or hybrid work model in our Cyprus office;
health insurance and mental health services;
13th salary and 21 vacation days per year;
provided lunches or food allowance;
monthly tuition reimbursement (kindergartens/schools);
opportunity to learn English and Greek;
sports reimbursement;
team buildings and parties;
bonuses for special events (e.g. child's birth).

Note:All applications will be treated with strict confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

description:
About us:

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in advanced wound care, ostomy care, continence and critical care, and infusion care. With around 10,000 colleagues, and a promise to be forever caring, our products and services are available in over 100 countries. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE: CTEC) and in 2021 revenues were over $2 billion. To learn more about Convatec, please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

Overall purpose of the Role

The BI Developer Engineer is responsible to implement complex and specialized data solutions ensuring high quality on the delivery always looking for opportunities to improve and automate.

As a Developer Engineer, you will be working with business users, collecting their requests, and then updating the set of existing BI reports to accommodate business needs. You will also be expected to establish company standards and common reporting terminology, and to help align existing and future reporting requests to such standards.

Good communications skills are required to partner with business leaders across the company creating unique conditions to make you grow in the BI and Analytics ecosystems. This role should act as an transformation agent in Convatec.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, and deliver self-service infrastructure and BI content, including reports and dashboards, to business professionals using last generation ETL/ELT tools, reporting tools, and Dashboarding.
Design and build data management solutions focused on data acquisition, data quality, data transformation, migration planning, schema structures, and master data management.
Provide hands-on design and implementation expertise around data warehousing, ETL, OLAP/tabular cubes, report development and data modelling across the company.
Document and communicate processes and data structures to preserve institutional knowledge.
Ensure a high level of data integrity and work output with attention to detail, while meeting time sensitive goals.
Proven experience of interpretation and presentation of defined Business requirements supporting best practice and guidelines in delivering optimal operational quality.
Experience in showcasing full capability and functionality of Power BI to the End User community
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and ability to demonstrate collaborative working with differing Teams across the IT landscape, including onshore and offshore.
Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective reporting and data visualization solutions to the various business units and executives.
Roll up sleeves and work hands-on with project teams to support objectives throughout delivery life cycle

Language Skills

English - Fluent
Portuguese (if not a native speaker)
Other languages can be a plus

What we are offering

Chance to move your career within the company that is the leader in delivering the pioneering trusted medical solution for the patients
Hybrid work model (1 day per week from the office in Lisbon)
Modern office space in the Lisbon city centre
Attractive compensation package with incentive plan and benefits
Great atmosphere across the team

Our progress will give you countless opportunities to move forward too. Seek out new challenges, and you‚Äôll find them. Stretch your thinking, and you‚Äôll find new ways to make an impact. And if you embrace the opportunity to drive your own growth, you could go further, and achieve more, than ever before.

This is a big step forward.

This is work that‚Äôll move you.

Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent Convatec

A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official Convatec email address.

If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at Convatec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If you‚Äôre unsure, please contact us at careers@Convatec.com.

Equal opportunities

Convatec provides equal employment opportunities for all current employees and applicants for employment. This policy means that no one will be discriminated against because of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, nationality, citizenship, ancestry, sex, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, genetic predisposing characteristics or any other basis prohibited by law.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives

Convatec is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Convatec employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written and signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Convatec. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Already a Convatec employee?

If you are an active employee at Convatec, please do not apply here. Go to the Career Worklet on your Workday home page and View "Convatec Internal Career Site - Find Jobs". Thank you!

description:
Permanent TSB is one of Ireland's leading retail and SME banks, with an innovative range of products and services powered through an evolving digital landscape, our focus is centred on ensuring we deliver what our customers, colleagues and communities need to be successful.

As an Analyst - Analytics Platforms & Processes, your role is to design, implement and maintain analytics systems and processes that support Bank-wide solutions including the implementation of IRB, IFRS9, collection, acquisition & data models as well as regulatory process deployments such as LCR, FINREP & COREP. You will also be required to perform in-depth analysis into model and process outputs to ensure they have been deployed accurately and correctly, that model drivers are clearly understood and key trends are identified

Responsibilities:

Support the production of model and process outputs, including key metrics
Support the ongoing enhancement and changes required to the systems that perform these calculations
Assist in the development of new systems and processes to adhere to emerging legislation
Provide excellent service to process owners by delivering high quality outputs within agreed timelines
Produce high quality insights across all portfolios covering required regulatory and operational requirements, key performance indicators, risks and trends
Research new technologies and techniques to drive efficiencies
Work with colleagues across business functions on multiple projects to deliver changes and enhancements
Maintain and test the systems to provide first class service to all users of the system
Produce model and process documentation as required
Ensure compliance with Risk and Control framework

Requirements:

The role requires rigorous analysis of data and the use of advanced methodologies. Candidates should possess, at a minimum, a third-level honours degree in a numerate subject area such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics
Excellent IT skills with proficiency in all of MS Office suite
Proven ability to prioritise workloads and will show determination and flexibility to deliver to very challenging timeframes
Experience and knowledge of programming and databases
An ability to communicate complex issues in a straightforward manner
Excellent documentation, report writing & presentation skills
Positive attitude with an eagerness to learn

This is a Permanent role based in Permanent TSB's St Stephens Green.

Is this you?

Please apply online on our website or via the apply link of this role. Your application will be sent through to our Talent Acquisition team and they will be in touch regarding your application. We reserve the right to draw up a shortlist for interview. The Bank understands the importance of a consistent and relentless focus on championing diversity and inclusion. We aim to attract, recruit, and retain individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills, competencies and abilities to work collaboratively to enhance the service we provide to all of our customers and the communities we serve.

description:
At Lyreco we all share a common goal to strive for passion, excellence, respect and agility. We are proud to be the European leader and the third largest distributor of workplace products and services in the world

We are committed to the development of our employees and we aim to achieve that by creating a culture that inspires and empowers.

Are you seeking a new challenge? This offer might be for you!

Net zoals de maatschappij, evolueert ook ons bedrijf heel snel. Daarbij spelen data natuurlijk een belangrijke rol. Zowel interne data als externe data. Belangrijke projecten zijn gebaseerd op de inzichten die deze data opleveren. Om die inzichten te verwerven en data projecten te co√∂rdineren, hebben we jou nodig.

Je bent zeer sterk in het omgaan met data, vindt er plezier in om het verhaal eruit naar boven te halen, en bent in staat dit verhaal te vertellen aan je collega‚Äôs uit verschillende departementen.

Je werkt gestructureerd en kan de nodige prioriteiten stellen gebaseerd op de strategische doeleinden en in overleg met stakeholders. Hoe ziet je dag eruit?

Management van segmentatie data

Data collectie, - validatie en - onderhoud
Verrijking van onze interne data
Management van prospect data uit externe bronnen

Koppeling aan onze interne data
Systeem uitzetten om dit inzichtelijk te maken.
Analyse

Vanuit de behoeften van je gesprekspartners de juiste data verzamelen, aan elkaar verbinden en van daaruit het juiste verhaal naar boven brengen
KPI‚Äôs opstellen in samenwerking met mensen uit verschillende departementen
Deze KPI‚Äôs opvolgen in een heldere rapportering
Geografische analyses uitvoeren
Projectwerking

Datagestuurd meedenken in projecten binnen de lokale en de internationale organisatie.
Proactief de organisatie voorzien van data-gedreven opportuniteiten

Bruikbare modellen en predicties opstellen en delen binnen de organisatie

Wie zoeken we?

Je bent analytisch en kritisch, en je houdt van een intellectuele uitdaging.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, nauwkeurig en stressbestendig.
Je hebt veel ervaring met data analyse.
Je bent sterk in Excel en VBA.
Ervaring met programmeren (SQL, R Studio, Python,‚Ä¶) is een vereiste.
Ervaring met een visualisatietool (Power BI, tableau,‚Ä¶) is een vereiste.
Ervaring met predictive modelling is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met database management is een pluspunt.
Je staat open voor nieuwe tools en omgevingen.
Je kan goed communiceren en schrikt niet van overleg met mensen uit andere departementen en/of landen.
Je houdt van projectmatig werk.
Je bent bereid te werken in een matrix omgeving.
Je kan je goed uitdrukken in Nederlands en Engels. Frans is een pluspunt.

Wat bieden we?

Een voltijdse en afwisselende job in een goed georganiseerd en gestructureerd internationaal bedrijf
Uitstekend marktconform salaris
Een bedrijfswagen en tankkaart, smartphone en tablet of laptop
Extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques en een hospitalisatieverzekering
20 vakantiedagen + 6 extralegale verlofdagen (o.b.v. 38-urige werkweek)
Een ruim opleidingspakket om jou als lid van de Lyreco familie verder te ontwikkelen

job_posting_title: Data analist Bij Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland
description:
Data analist

Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland

Delft, 36 uur, salaris minimaal ‚Ç¨ 3736 - maximaal ‚Ç¨ 5092 Als data analist ben je een echte specialist op het gebied van data-analyse en het gebruik van tools met de focus op PowerBI. Door jouw kennis in te zetten in ons team groeien wij naar een betere samenwerkingspartner in de organisatie. Ben jij die data enthousiasteling die wil meebouwen aan het team Datagedreven Werken? Dan komen wij graag met jou in contact!

Wat ga je doen?

Vanuit de hele organisatie komen datavraagstukken. Jij pakt die met het team op en speelt een actieve rol bij het verduidelijken van het vraagstuk en het beoordelen van de haalbaarheid ervan. Samen met de data engineer ga je aan de slag met de databronnen en zorgt dat data op een juiste manier gebruikt kan worden. Je maakt een mooi dashboard met behulp van PowerBI (DAX) en Azure (SQL) waarmee je een organisatieonderdeel inzichten biedt, die niet meer handmatig gegenereerd hoeven te worden. Ook bied jij de organisatie de mogelijkheid zelf rapporten te maken. Tenslotte zorg jij dat de datastromen en de rapportagetool op een goede manier beheerd worden. Verder hou je je bezig met het:

Opstellen van aanpak om data te verkrijgen over of ter ondersteuning van bedrijfsprocessen;
Verwerken van de verkregen data, deze omzetten tot begrijpbare informatie en hierover advies geven;
Opstellen van automatische rapportages;
Cre√´ren van datamodellen en visualisaties;
Het ondersteunen van self service analytics;
Beheren van datastromen en rapportages.

Meer weten? Bel of mail Anna!

Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met:

Anna Zanstra Corporate recruiter en adviseurazanstra@hhdelfland.nl06-46885095

Wat bieden we jou?

Deze functie is ingedeeld in schaal 10 van de CAO Werken voor Waterschappen en kent een minimum van ‚Ç¨ 3.736,- en een maximum van ‚Ç¨ 5.092,-bruto per maand. Doorgroeien naar een senior positie in schaal 11 (een minimum van ‚Ç¨ 4.149,- en een maximum van ‚Ç¨ 5.742,-) behoort tot de mogelijkheden.
Een aanstelling van een jaar, met intentie tot een vast dienstverband.
Het betreft een fulltime functie van 36 uur per week (1,0 fte).
Afwisselend werken op onze prachtige locatie in hartje Delft en vanuit huis.
Een Individueel KeuzeBudget (IKB) ter waarde van 21% van het salaris. Dit budget geeft jou de vrijheid om zelf te beslissen of je extra verlof wil kopen, een studie wil financieren of bijvoorbeeld je basissalaris maandelijks wil aanvullen.
Wij stellen ‚Ç¨ 6000,- beschikbaar voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling, dit noemen wij ‚ÄòPersoonsgebonden Basis Budget‚Äô, waar het om gaat is dat wij jou stimuleren jezelf te ontwikkelen.
Je krijgt een NS-businesscard of als je niet met het OV reist, dan krijg je netto ‚Ç¨ 0,21 per km. Je kan ook tegen gunstige voorwaarden een fiets aanschaffen voor je woon-werkverkeer.
Delfland biedt een mooie aanvulling op de wettelijke ouderschapsverlofregeling
Samen met Fello bieden wij mantelzorgondersteuning. We vinden het namelijk belangrijk dat werkende mantelzorgers ondersteund worden.

Wat maakt jou succesvol?

Je bent klantgericht en communicatief vaardig zodat je optimaal kan bijdragen aan de gezamenlijke doelen van Delfland. Hierbij kan je zowel goed zelfstandig werken als in teamverband. Je werkt nauwkeurig en je kan plannen, rapportages en informatie helder verwoorden.Behalve deze vaardigheden heb jij naast aantoonbaar hbo werk- en denkniveau ook:

Minimaal zes maanden werkervaring met Azure of een vergelijkbare clouddienst.
Minimaal twee jaar werkervaring met PowerBI of een vergelijkbare applicatie.Verder maken een proactieve werkhouding en gevoel voor humor jouw profiel compleet!

Waar kom je te werken?

De afdeling IMG is verantwoordelijk voor de informatievoorziening van Delfland. Zo‚Äôn 40 bevlogen professionals houden zich bezig met thema‚Äôs als architectuur, functioneel beheer, gegevensbeheer, GEO-informatie en GIS, business analytics, documentbeheer, archivering en data-gedreven werken. Er heerst een informele en open werksfeer waar op vaste dagen afwisselend op kantoor en vanuit huis wordt samengewerkt.Het Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland heeft een belangrijke maatschappelijke taak: wij zorgen voor droge voeten en schoon water in een dichtbevolkt en intensief gebruikt stukje Nederland. En hoewel Delfland ruim 730 jaar bestaan, zijn we allesbehalve ouderwets. We besteden veel aandacht aan belangrijke maatschappelijke thema‚Äôs zoals klimaatadaptatie, duurzaamheid, circulariteit en inclusiviteit. Geworteld in het verleden werken we zo, samen met verschillende partijen, aan een mooie toekomst voor ons gebied en onze inwoners!

Onze drive

Onze ambitie is groot maar onze drive om samen te werken naar een schone en veilige leefomgeving is nog groter!

Sollicitatieproces

illustratie Eerste gesprek Tweede gesprek Optioneel klikgesprek Arbeidsvoorwaarden- gesprek en aanbod Je hebt de baan!

Interessante baan?

Contact

Stuur dan jouw motivatie en CV uiterlijk 18 juni via de link. De 1e gespreksronde staat gepland op dinsdag 27 juni as, de 2e gespreksronde op vrijdag 30 juni as. We vragen je daar alvast rekening mee te houden.Voor vragen over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Robin van den Assem (06-31645005, Product Owner team Datagedreven Werken). Voor vragen over de procedure kun je contact opnemen met Anna Zanstra, recruiter (06-48665095).

description:
Who are we?

At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increased demand for storage and computing. Our portfolio spans power, thermal and infrastructure management products, software and solutions, and is complemented by a network of nearly 250 service centers worldwide.

We are now looking for a Junior Data Analystto join our team in Cluj-Napoca, Romania.

Summary

Vertiv Service business is designed to provide full life-cycle service support for our customers and as such is a core part of the Vertiv market offering. On site activity is a crucial element of Vertiv Service organization around the world. Vertiv CE are doing hundreds of thousands visits every year to maintain the critical infrastructures devices supporting Vertiv Customer applications.

As Junior Data Analystyou will within Big Data team to deliver meaningful output for use by the business and its customers. This could be different type reports like performance (equipment, site, operational) analysis, statistical (bench marking, operational, site, customer) analysis, maintenance planning, cost analysis for service contracts, etc.

In this role, you will be working directly with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, cross functional teams across various teams, both at a Regional and Global level, as well as Technology, Data, Insights & Analytics teams.

Reporting relationship:

This position will report directly to Big Data Team Leader, who reports to Global Service Platforms organization.

Essential role functions:

Interpret the data, analyses results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports that will convert into business opportunities.
Work with Management Systems leaders (Product Management and Marketing) and with the experts in the different technologies to priorities business and information needs.
Actively work with the Center of Expertise leaders (Thermal, AC and DC power, Batteries, Generators) to identify the needs for data collection at system, site and network level.
Collect feedback from Technical experts to improve the reports and data collection and verify that the improvements suggested have achieved the expected results.

Additional responsibilities might be assigned:

Define, with the subject matter and product specialists, the data to collect from the systems and site process sold and utilized by Vertiv.
Define strategies to optimize statistics in terms of efficiency and quality, including filter and clean data defining KPI's to identify problems at data base level.
Collaborate with the Monitoring solution architects to assure the efficiency of the data collection in different projects and solutions.
Work with the Global and regional teams to design, develop and maintain the Service Analytics concept. Develop and maintain the Global Data Lake used in conjunction with the Analytics Service organization plus other requirements as needed by the company.

Minimum qualifications:

Degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
Working experience for minimum 1-2 years as a data analyst or business data analyst preferably oriented to IoT and M2M environments.
Technical knowledge regarding data (models, mining, cleansing, segmentation) and database design techniques.
Good knowledge and experience with BI reporting packages (Power BI, Tableau, etc), databases (SQL, etc), programming (Python, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Modeling skills to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment text representations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyses, and disseminate significant amounts of information from different technical environments.
Knowledge and capability to understand specific applications in the Data Center, Telecom, Industrial and Edge segments.
Strong Communication skills and be able to pick new technology as we expand our data analytics footprint
Ability to ideate and be able to pursue those ideas to deliver business value

Language skills: English - Advanced/native level; Any additional major foreign language is a plus.

Travel Required: approximately 10% to visit real installations and Vertiv Center of Expertise

Location:Rumania - Normal office environment and schedule. Geographically distributed (virtual) team.

Are Youthe one we are looking for? Perfect! Apply directly to this job ad and take the first step towards a career with Vertiv!

description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

Do you love digging into data to find insights and solve problems?

Are you excited to work in a fast-paced global environment?

Do you thrive in an open, positive, and dynamic culture built on competence and trust?

If you answered yes to the above, then the Finance Analyst role may be a good fit for you.

As a finance analyst at VMware, you‚Äôll be part of a global team that provides the visibility, reporting and insight for data driven decision making. You will get hands-on experience presenting financial results to business partners, managing operational expenses, tracking metrics, implementing process improvements, and researching drivers impacting future investments. You will get opportunities to innovate, build your own models, grow your role and become a trusted finance advisor.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

Forecast and analyze headcount (HC) and OPEX spend for assigned organizational unit:

Within 30 days of employment, become competent with VMware‚Äôs FP&A processes, fiscal calendar, and main tools.
Within 90 days you would be independently updating HC and OPEX forecast for assigned organization based on latest available information and would be executing on period close activities as per applicable timelines
Within 180 days you would be in position to maintain and distribute regular reporting packages and analyze variances to forecast; be able to provide commentary and additional context to business partners and address other ad hoc requests they might have
Within 360 days you would be ready to review and challenge HC and OPEX investment requests received from the business as well as assist in developing new financial models supporting long term planning and scenario evaluation
You would be collaborating with other colleagues from Finance, Accounting, Procurement, Operations and Sales to improve existing reporting and build new dashboards as requirements evolve

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

The primary goal of this role is to support the business with all the aspects of HC and OPEX financial management. Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, but you can expect a variety of the following assignments:

Prepare and input in Hyperion OPEX and HC forecast as per FP&A calendar; discuss main assumptions, risks, and opportunities with business and central sales finance
Review spend and make variance analysis using SAP BI, general ledger and other available data sources
Complete close tasks as per quarterly schedule
Review and approve Purchase and Personnel Requisitions; make sure approved spend is as per budget, drives savings or has reasonable ROI
Update excel dashboards and power point decks required as per the regular reporting schedule
Maintain and start building financial models for evaluating existing and up-coming investment initiatives
Manage queries and reporting requests from the various stakeholders

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

You would be joining the 50+ Sofia Finance Team. The global team is spread across the VMware offices including Palo Alto, Cork, Bangalore and Heredia.

We are a community that supports each other and strives to provide psychological safety. Our team culture is one based on trust, having pride in one‚Äôs work, continuous improvement and adaptivity.

Where is this role located?

Flexible: The location of this role is flexible within Sofia region. Work will be done from an office some days during a week and other days from a non-VMware building.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

VMware offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package for you and your loved ones. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long-term incentives
Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, open communication
Work-life balance ‚Äì 25 days paid vacation
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

description:
Functieomschrijving

For our client, a pharmaceutical company in Zwijnaarde, we are looking for a QC Analyst. Your tasks and responsabilities include:

Responsible for the completion of QC testing related to the manufacturing of autologous CART products for clinical trials and commercial operation in a controlled cGMP cleanroom environment.
Ensure testing is completed in compliance with all applicable procedures, standards and GMP regulations.
Work with Process Development team, Quality and Operations organization to successfully transfer process/analytical testing to cGMP facility to manufacture products.
Conduct analytical testing of raw material/utility, in-process, or final product samples submitted to the QC laboratories.
Perform peer review/approval of laboratory data.
Utilize electronic systems (LIMS) for execution and documentation of testing.
Create, review and approve relevant QC documents, SOP‚Äôs and WI‚Äôs.
Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements.
Other duties will be assigned, as necessary
Profiel

Education:
A minimum of a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent technical

discipline is required or relevant years of experience within the pharmaceutical

industry.

Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years relevant work experience is required. It is preferable that

the candidate have experience working in an aseptic manufacturing facility,

preferably in quality assurance, manufacturing compliance, clinical quality, or cell

therapy.

Aanbod

You will end up in the fascinating world of biotechnology in a strong and respectful, diverse team in which everyone is welcome.
You will receive an attractive salary and a permanent position.
You will work with a diverse team that speaks English and Dutch.
The first year you will work in a dayshift. In 2024 you will work in a 2 shift regime.

Our client is a global biotechnology company dedicated to the treatment and cure of life-threatening diseases. They are in full expansion and are looking for motivated and committed employees. As an employee at the company, you make a daily difference in the lives of many patients who suffer from cancer and other life-threatening diseases.

Rouen

Ferrero est une entreprise familiale dot√©e d‚Äôune approche progressiste et mondiale, repr√©sent√©e par des marques embl√©matiques telles que Nutella¬Æ, Tic Tac¬Æ, Ferrero Rocher¬Æ, Raffaello¬Æ, Kinder Bueno¬Æ et Kinder Surprise¬Æ. √Ä mesure que notre passion envers nos marques va croissant, il en va de m√™me pour notre port√©e internationale qui pousse sans cesse ses fronti√®res toujours plus loin. Le Groupe Ferrero est pr√©sent dans 55 pays et ses produits sont vendus dans plus de 170. Les g√©n√©rations du monde entier nous portent dans leur c≈ìur. Quel est donc le secret de notre r√©ussite internationale ?

description:
L-Stone Capital, launched in October 2022 and based in Athens, Greece, is a seed / seed+ venture capital firm.

We invest in companies that are looking to take advantage of the monumental changes in the post Covid-19 world and the 4th Industrial Revolution.

L-Stone Capital provides financing and support high-quality and ambitious Management teams in growing their start-ups into scalable international businesses.

Having completed our first investments, we are looking to strengthen the team with an Analyst / Associate.

This is a dual investing / operational role providing an excellent career path for a highly motivated individual within a highly ambitious and growing platform.

The role represents the opportunity to join an open and flat team culture where everyone is encouraged to contribute to all investment discussions.

Key Responsibilities:

Assisting in sourcing & evaluating potential investment ideas ‚Äì you will be part of the full investment process from origination to exit

Investment screening
Investment report writing
Due-diligence and market research
Financial modelling
Portfolio monitoring & active interaction with portfolio companies

Assisting in LP reporting

Preparation of presentations
Assisting in LP reporting

Leading operational tasks

Ongoing communication with external parties (e.g. custodian, lawyers, auditors, advisors etc.)
Assisting in fund structuring, auditing, valuation, tax management etc.
Assisting in preparation of fund calculations, IRR returns etc.
Management of capital calls, wire payments, distributions, etc.
Monitoring and review of fund expenses
Managing website and LinkedIn etc (posting new investment, portfolio updates etc.)

Experience & Skills:

Excellent educational background from a top academic institution
Minimum 2 years of work experience (management consulting, investment banking, engineering and start-ups could be a relevant background; however, given the highly dynamic nature of venture capital, exceptional candidates from a wide spectrum of work experience can be considered)
Ambitious & driven
Entrepreneurial - seeing and taking opportunities
Commercial and highly analytical mindset with: (i) strong analytical skills and ability to evaluate risks & opportunities (ii) ability to research & analyse businesses from an industrial and strategic point of view, not only financial, (iii) enthusiasm to create and own a network of key stakeholders
Excellent communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to prioritise & work independently
Fluency in English

description:
Job Description

Career Family, Level & Title: Senior Professional

Job Type: Permanent

Closing Date: 24 February 2023

Who are we?

We want to be the best place that any of our colleagues have ever worked.

At Standard Life International, we believe everyone should have a future to look forward to, and that means looking after our customers, our shareholders, and our people. Standard Life succeeds because of our people ‚Äì our skills, passions and experience. We will help you grow and progress by acknowledging your talent and rewarding you fairly. In return, you‚Äôll give us your energy, enthusiasm and the drive to deliver results.

We are a part of the Phoenix Group. Phoenix Group are the UK‚Äôs largest long-term savings and retirement business with c.13 million customers and c.¬£300 billion of assets under administration. As a market leader and FTSE100 organisation, we understand that our scale and expertise means that we have a key role to play for our customers, colleagues and our communities to help as many people as possible secure a life of possibilities. We are tackling key environmental and social issues such as transitioning our portfolio to net zero by 2050 ‚Äì but we‚Äôre not done yet.

We‚Äôve seen huge growth and change, and this means there is enormous opportunity for our 7,000 colleagues to grow alongside us.

Flexible working

You can expect to work in a hybrid manner with time spent working in the office and at home. We believe that work/life balance offers benefits for customers as well as ensuring that you can balance a successful career with your life outside of work. We will discuss flexibility, what is important to you and balancing this with business requirements during the recruitment process.

Role Context

We currently have an opportunity within the Calculations Team. Working within a small team, the role reports directly to the team manager and will involve interaction with senior colleagues across the Irish branch as well as colleagues based in UK. The Calculations team sits within the Operations function in the Irish branch.

Role Purpose

Within Standard Life Ireland, the Calculations Team is responsible for supporting system development by producing calculation specifications in initial design stage of projects and following through with testing these developments.

In addition, the team supports the business when system failure occurs. This can range from producing statements that have failed, to analysing and remediating system calculation errors, calculating policy values and ensuring our quotations and statements are correct and comply with regulations.

The successful candidate must be highly numerate with an ability to understand and use formulae in Excel, have an analytical mind, logical decision making abilities, strong problem solving skills, be an excellent communicator and must enjoy working as part of a team. Knowledge of Standard Life‚Äôs products and systems, and an ability to demonstrate working in an analytical environment will be advantageous.

Key Roles And Responsibilities

Represent the team as subject matter expert on a wide range of projects
Produce calculation specifications when required
Test calculation development to ensure that systems are working as intended
Calculate values and/or produce adhoc/annual statements for policies when our systems fail
Maintain and develop calculation spread sheets that are used by the team and in other areas of the business
Act as document owner for documents owned by the team
Investigate and remediate calculation issues as and when they arise
Perform monthly processes
Assist with complaint handling
Production of With Profits Investment Report and PRSA Schedules
Maintain a working knowledge of the legislation and regulations appropriate to the role

Required Skills

Numerical Honours Degree Qualified is desirable but not essential
Experience in the Financial Services
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Highly numerate with an ability to understand, use and create complex formulae
Attention to detail
Keen business sense and an ability to simplify complex details
Strong customer focus
Ability to work alone and cross functionally and able to adapt and react to continuous demand changes
Performance driven individual and self-motivated
Excellent communication, particularly of technical concepts with the ability to make the complex simple (verbal and written)
Provide technical support and coaching to less experienced analysts in area of expertise.
Balancing competing priorities on different pieces of work.
Influencing decision across SL project teams where priorities and interests are often conflicting.
Will escalate issues that have a high impact to the appropriate manager using the established governance frameworks.
Authorised to produce non standard quotes, provide information on technical area of expertise to internal and external customers, but cannot give advice.

What We Offer

Bring your ‚Äòwhole self‚Äô, skills and dedication to the Phoenix Group and we‚Äôll recognise your effort, support your development and help to drive your ambition. We‚Äôll ensure you‚Äôre rewarded for your contribution with a competitive package that includes an attractive pension, annual bonus potential, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlement, enhanced maternity and adoption leave and a range of other financial services and lifestyle flexible benefits.

Join us and you join a unique organisation. It‚Äôs not just the 14 million policyholders we serve, or the ¬£300 billion of assets we look after. Or that we‚Äôre a FTSE 100 company that has been listed as one of the UK's Top Employers for nine years running. It‚Äôs our talented, inclusive and diverse workforce that makes us a success. We offerflexible workingopportunities ensuring we attract and retain the very best of talent. Find out about more about our people‚Äôsstories, ourvaluesand our commitment todiversity.

We value diversity in our workforce and welcome enquiries from everyone.

description:
A new job as Junior Business Analyst has just been created in an international company located in the South of Brussels in the FMCG sector. You will be integrating a team of 5 other controllers, and you will be reporting to the Head of Controlling.

As a Junior Business Analyst, you will be responsible of the following tasks:

Contribute to the preparation of the Promotion ROI analysis and improvement proposal to the local team.
Contribute to the preparation of the Customer profitability analysis and overview presentation to local Finance team and to SLT on a session basis.
Participate actively to the construction of the budget and forecast in close collaboration with the local commercial organization with a particular focus on trade agreements.
Support the Financial Reporting, Controlling Manager, and the local team in the Gross to Net analysis and ensure that the sales teams have adequate tools and templates to support the development of the annual plan.
Contribute to the preparation of the Commercial Profit & Loss by Product.
Ideal Profile Of The Junior Business Analyst

Master degree (Business) Economics/Controlling
A first experience of 2 years in a controlling department
FMCG or Retail background is a plus
Advanced skills in Excel and the knowledge of Power Pivot or Power BI is a plus
Fluent in English & French
Good communication skills to collaborate with and challenge key stakeholders
Our Client Is Offering You

A permanent contract
The possibility to work 2 days at home
Continuous trainings
To be part of renowned family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands
A very attractive salary package with interesting advantages in line with your experience
If you have strong organisation and analytical skills, as well as being detail oriented, this job as Junior Business Analyst is what you have been looking for. Do not hesitate to send your CV today with the reference YNN1916912.

description:
There are countless tempting destinations, and we all dream about them. The most desirable destination for all of us is the perfect workplace! Our consultants work commits to finding the working environment you thrive in.

The Role: Conducting a thorough analysis of historical sales data and devising predictive models to evaluate the efficiency of business strategies. Developing and deploying a rigorous KPI framework. Collaborating with the rest of the business unit and being able to communicate cross-functionally to identify new market opportunities as well as ensure a successful rollout of new product offerings.

The Company:Esteemed manufacturer with eco-friendly and environmentally responsible range of products. The main goal is to modernize and streamline operations by moving towards digital solutions, while already being well-known for investing in cutting-edge technologies at their production sites.

The Culture:Atmosphere that is specifically tailored to promote stability and cultivate employee growth. Continues to implement sustainable practices and put their customers needs first. Prioritizes environmental protection and works actively towards minimizing the impact of their products.

The Offer:Remuneration and bonus scheme supplemented by a comprehensive benefits package that includes additional health insurance, food vouchers and sports card.

The Candidate:Experienced in sales, marketing, and finance professional with 3+ years in corporate trading and skilled in analyzing business hypotheses. A degree in Economics, Finance, Business administration or a related field is mandatory. Proficient Business English as well as hands-on experience in project management and process enhancement are necessary. Ability to use Power BI, ERP systems as well as familiarity with analytical engines, other MS Office programs and preferably SQL, will be considered as assets.

If you would like to participate in the company's business growth through data-driven insights, don't hesitate and drop us your CV!

description:
ALOHAS is more than a fashion brand: it‚Äôs a responsible shopping experience and a chance to participate in the fight against overproduction in fashion.

Working at ALOHAS is being part of the innovation and growth of a Spanish start-up with a young, creative and proactive team, good communication and a high level of energy! It‚Äôs demanding but extremely rewarding due to an environment where we take pride in learning from one another and strive to make sustainability a way of life beyond the workplace.

In a nutshell,we love what we do and it shows!üòÄ

THE ROLE

We are looking for an Analytics Specialist, highly motivated self-starter who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and proficient at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment as a data-driven marketer.

You'll be the owner of the technical analytics framework collaborating with Global Digital Director on insights from audiences engaging in other Product tools to inform conversion opportunities and growth, helping ALOHAS to improve and optimize its online marketing activities.

YOUR CHALLENGE

Willard and Alice Marriott and guided by Marriott family leadership for nearly 90 years, the company is headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland, USA.

description:
Are you a big data expert? We are looking for a creative developer to strengthen our geospatial intelligence team

Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. Sustainability at Scania is also about having a healthy work place with diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities for men and women.

Our team, Connected Intelligence, is a group within Connected Systems at Scania R&D. In the context of connectivity, we innovate and deliver scalable analytics that enables informed decision-making for product, service, and business developers.

Do you want to shape our solutions in close cooperation with the stakeholders and the development teams? We provide an environment where we apply agile working methods and where the teams are responsible for their solutions all the way from requirement handling, development, quality assurance to production, and root cause analysis.

Together with us, you get a key role in shaping tomorrow's connected transport system. Our motivation comes from working for a bigger picture where collaboration, innovation, and exploration are common drivers among your colleagues.

Your Assignment

We want to strengthen the geospatial intelligence team to further develop our visualisation and infrastructure for self-service solutions that democratize data from Scania‚Äôs connected fleet of more than 500.000 vehicles. The data is derived from GPS-positions, operational vehicle data and other data sources that describe and help improve the global transport network.

You will be working in a cross-functional team to deliver repeatable and quality-assured results through self-sustained analytics services. The competencies in each team usually cover a wide range of areas, such as software development, data engineering, data science and front-end interaction and visualization of data.

The daily work is planned and carried out following agile principles, where your team is part of the department‚Äôs flow. You will contribute with your core competence and be responsible for tasks assigned to you during each sprint while over longer periods contributing to the overall planning and vision of the team.

Your profile

You have an academic degree in a computer science related field or equivalent work experience.

As an experienced developer or data scientist, you are analytical, with a genuine technical interest. You enjoy collaboration with different competencies to find the best solution to a problem.

In Addition

You understand how to turn requirements into code to continuously deliver value as you go along.
You have a high-quality focus and an understanding of how industrialized solutions scale -what we build is what we will run in production. Continuous improvement of the development process is a natural priority for you.
You have experience in one or more of the following areas: working with data streaming, big data analytics, cloud software development, geospatial visualisations and/or operational vehicle or transport data.

You communicate fluently in English in both speech and writing.

Our offer

We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with focus on respect for the individual, where you have many opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.

In addition to personal and professional development opportunities, we offer benefits such as company car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer direct bus service between Stockholm and S√∂dert√§lje, Scania Job Express. You can also work from our office in central Stockholm from time to time, Scania Sergel.

Contact information

If you have questions about the job you are welcome to contact Frank Deubzer, recruiting manager, at frank.deubzer@scania com

Application

If you feel you have the skills and desire to take on this interesting role, don¬¥t hesitate to apply! Submit your CV and relevant certificates. You don't have to send a cover letter, just upload your CV twice.

Screening and‚ÄØinterviews‚ÄØwill‚ÄØbe‚ÄØdone‚ÄØcontinuously.‚ÄØA background check might be conducted for this position.

We‚ÄØare looking‚ÄØforward to‚ÄØyour‚ÄØapplication!

Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

description:
At the moment we are looking for a dedicated Data Expert. You will be working in a team of passionate Data Experts focused on sustainable and impact investments. You'll gather, clean, and analyse data from multiple sources, collaborate on innovative projects, and create insightful reports and dashboards.

Project Details

Location: Rotterdam
Type: Hybrid
Duration: 12 months

Responsibilities

Gather and clean data from multiple sources, including data providers, clients, and custodians.
Link financial and sustainability data to ACTIAM investments and analyse the results using software tools and Microsoft BI (SSMS and SSAS).

5+ years of relevant work experience.

Proficiency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.

description:
Beschik jij over de juiste kwaliteiten en denk je een goede toevoeging te zijn voor Trilations? Solliciteer dan voor de functie als Data Analyst. Dan krijg je binnenkort bericht van ons!

De vacature

Het initi√´le traject ziet er als volgt uit: De eerste weken leer je de Qlik tools kennen, door zowel interne als externe trainingen te volgen. Je wordt ingeschakeld bij bestaande klanten om support en change request taken uit te voeren, eerst ondersteund door een senior consultant, maar snel zelfstandig. Je doet je eerste projecten onder begeleiding van een senior consultant.

Hier gaan we vanuit

Je hebt een goeie feeling voor BI-oplossingen en een sterke interesse in data, analyses, business intelligence en reporting. Een eerste ervaring in het ontwikkelen van BI-oplossingen in Qlik of een andere BI-tool (Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau) levert je een voorsprong op. Je bent enthousiast, toont zin voor initiatief en je staat open voor nieuwe ervaringen. Je bent gedreven in het zoeken naar technische oplossingen voor business vragen en hoe je die kan realiseren met de voorhanden zijnde BI tools. description:
Country

Bulgaria

Job Family

Operations

For almost 90 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world‚Äôs biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer‚Äôs life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, ROI, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of 8,000+ employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and will support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future, as we continue our evolution from Market Research provider to SaaS data solutions and consulting partner. We value extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

Junior Market Data Analyst - sector Fashion

Mission Of The Role

The purpose of the role is to ensure the quantitative and qualitative control of marketing data and the creation of new products in existing databases, complying with all global quality requirements.

You Will

Search for information on the Internet about the characteristics of different products for the sector Fashion.
Enter the received information in a database or Excel.
Categorize, classify and update of information in Excel.
Ensure quality data control.
Manage the monthly production of data through internal platforms.
Ensure the publication of data according to customer requirements and deadlines.
Track several market trends.
Work with specialized applications for database processing.
Cooperation with other internal departments and partners of GfK.
Report to Service Manager GSC MI.
You Have

University degree in: Economics, Mathematics, Information Technology, Data Management or other related area
Working level in English (B1 - B2)
Good knowledge of MS Office (Excel)
In-depth knowledge of methods, procedures and tools for data processing and analysis
Initiative and analytical thinking
Attention to detail
Maintaining high- quality standards
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Skills to work within deadlines and goals
Benefits

Use the latest digital technologies.
Ongoing trainings to support your development.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Competitive remuneration and bonus scheme linked to individual performance and company results.
Flexible working hours and home office.
3 additional non-working days annually.
Food vouchers
Health insurance
Discount program with external vendors
Multisport card
Eco friendly travelers are welcome to the office ‚Äì parking places for bikers and free card for public transportation are available to all employees
Last but not least ‚Äì GfK Sofia office is located close to the city centre and easily accessible from any point by public transportation ‚Äì 47A Tsarisgradsko Shose Blvd
All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit and make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to get to know you!

description:
7538 BGP Products Operations GmbH

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access ‚Äì Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;
Leadership ‚Äì Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and
Partnership ‚Äì Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

The Data Quality Analyst will be part of a new and developing Data Quality Management team within Viatris responsible for driving data quality best practices and supporting data quality improvement initiatives. The Data Quality Analyst will work closely with internal business partners, IT and business analysts to define and execute data assessment plans, perform root cause analyses and manage data quality reporting.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here‚Äôs how the Data Quality Analystrole will make an impact:

Work with both business and technical SMEs to document business rules and codify them into data quality rules.
Support ongoing monitoring, analysis and reporting of data quality metrics.
Prepare and consolidate data for established, periodic review and maintain data quality dashboards.
Recommend establishment of new or modified reporting methods and procedures to improve data collection and reporting.
Assisting in root cause analysis, investigating any data errors or anomalies and assisting in the implementation of solutions to correct data problems.
Coordinate various data cleansing and enrichment activities.
Develop data quality reporting tools and reports.
Support and supervise data acquisition and reporting processes for assigned projects.
Drive the continuous improvement of the Data Quality Management program by refining processes and methods, tools and systems.
Communicate Data Quality non-compliance to Stewards and Business users to resolve issues.

About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we‚Äôre looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:

Passionate about the value of quality data.
Minimum 3-5 years relevant data analytics or data quality management experience.
Strong understanding of data quality management principles. Familiarity with TIQM a plus.
Must possess strong analytical, communication (written and verbal), and organizational skills.
Hands on experience and current skills developing and performing data quality analysis with a variety of software tools and SQL.
Proficient with SQL. Familiar with Microsoft SQL Server a plus, but not required.
Proficient with MS Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in relevant discipline.
Experience with data quality analysis tools a plus.
Ability to present technical and non-technical information in appropriate terms to suit the audience and purpose.
Ability to communicate effectively at all levels.
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity.

At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Benefits At Viatris

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. Some of our benefits include the following on top of a competitive salary:

Excellent career progression opportunities
Work-life balance initiatives
Bonus scheme
Health insurance
Pension

Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
