description:
Company Information

Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell, T-cell receptor (TCR-T), and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy. From our three R&D sites around the world, we apply these innovative technologies to pursue the discovery of safe, efficacious and cutting-edge therapeutics for patients worldwide.

Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen Biotech, Inc. to develop, manufacture and commercialize ciltacabtagene autoleucel (cilta-cel). Through our strategic partnership, we look to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma.

Role Overview

The QC Analyst, CAR-T Manufacturing is an exempt level position with responsibilities for performing

QC testing related to the manufacturing of cell therapy products for clinical trials and commercial

operations in a controlled GMP environment.

Major Responsibilities:

Responsible for the completion of QC testing related to the manufacturing of autologous CART products for clinical trials and commercial operation in a controlled cGMP cleanroom environment.
Ensure testing is completed in compliance with all applicable procedures, standards and GMP regulations.
Work with Process Development team, Quality and Operations organization to successfully transfer process/analytical testing to cGMP facility to manufacture products.
Conduct analytical testing of raw material/utility, in-process, or final product samples submitted to the QC laboratories.
Perform peer review/approval of laboratory data.
Utilize electronic systems (LIMS) for execution and documentation of testing.
Create, review and approve relevant QC documents, SOP‚Äôs and WI‚Äôs.
Perform tasks in a manner consistent with the safety policies, quality systems and cGMP requirements.
Other duties will be assigned, as necessary

Qualification

Education:

A minimum of a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Science, Engineering or equivalent technical

discipline is required or relevant years of experience within the pharmaceutical

industry.

Experience:

A minimum of 1-2 years relevant work experience is required. It is preferable that

the candidate have experience working in an aseptic manufacturing facility,

preferably in quality assurance, manufacturing compliance, clinical quality, or cell

therapy.

Capabilities, Knowledge, and skills:

Experience in a Quality Control setting is preferred.
Experience with aseptic processing in ISO 5 clean room and biosafety cabinets is required.
Knowledge of cGMP regulations and FDA/EU guidance related to manufacturing of cell-based products is required.
Knowledge of Good Tissue Practices is required.
Detailed knowledge of CAR-T QC test methods and related equipment is preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skill are required
Candidates must be able to accommodate shift schedule. Shifts include routine weekend and evening work as required by the manufacturing process.
Candidates must be able to accommodate unplanned overtime (including nights and weekends) on little to no prior notice.
The candidate must be highly organized and capable of working in a team environment with a positive attitude under some supervision.
Comfortable with speaking and interacting with inspectors.
This position may require occasional travel to partner sites in NJ or PA as business demands.
This position may require up to 10% domestic or international travel as business demands.

Language(s):

English

Legend Biotech is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Legend‚Äôs policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Legend Biotech maintains a drug-free workplace.

description:
Smarttech247 is seeking a highly motivated and customer-oriented Data Governance Specialist to join our team. As a Data Governance Specialist, you will play a crucial role in providing data governance solutions and support to our clients. You will work closely with clients to understand their data governance needs and provide guidance and recommendations to enhance their data management practices. Your strong communication skills and technical expertise will be instrumental in building trusted relationships with our customers.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to understand their data governance requirements and challenges, across areas such as DLP, DLM, Data Classification etc.
Deploy and enforce data governance policies and procedures tailored to each client's specific needs, ensuring data quality, usability, consistency, availability, security, and integrity.
Assess and evaluate client concerns related to data governance, providing problem definitions, opportunity and solution recommendations, and root cause analysis.
Support client compliance with relevant data protection regulations and industry standards.
Stay updated on the latest developments in data governance, data management, and data protection regulations to provide valuable insights and recommendations to clients.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a field related to computers, such as Information Technology or Computer Science.
1-3 years of experience in data governance, data management, or a related field. Experience in implementing data governance programmes or initiatives is highly desirable.
Strong understanding of data governance principles, including data quality, data lifecycle management, and regulatory compliance.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively engage and collaborate with clients of varying technical backgrounds.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear and actionable recommendations for clients.
Knowledge of data protection regulations, such as GDPR, and their implications for data governance practices.
Familiarity with data management tools, data cataloguing, and metadata management systems is a plus.
Attention to detail and strong analytical skills for problem-solving and root cause analysis.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple client engagements simultaneously

job_posting_title: Jobs | Data Analyst - Risk & ICM Data Delivery | Brussel
description:
Omschrijving

Bij Belfius geloven we dat data de basis vormen van onze digitale transformatie. Of het nu gaat om digitale marketing, het leveren van producten en diensten op maat, het nemen van tactische en strategische beslissingen, het verbeteren van de procedures of het monitoren van onze prestaties, data spelen in dat verband een cruciale rol.

Elke dag opnieuw vinden miljoenen verrichtingen plaats in de systemen van Belfius, wat telkens data oplevert. In het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team moeten wij die gegevens begrijpen en ze vertalen in insights en tools ontwikkelen ter ondersteuning van de beslissingen en de strategie van de metiers.

De job in een notendop

Wij zijn op zoek naar iemand die ons kan ondersteunen in onze activiteiten inzake reporting en kwaliteitscontrole. In die functie hebt jij twee expertisedomeinen:

producten die provisieloon opleveren (rekeningen, fondsen, beleggingen enz.)
de kosten, en dat voor alle activiteiten van de bank

In die context krijg jij twee hoofdtaken toebedeeld. Aan de ene kant voer je analyses uit van de maandelijkse resultaten en zorg jij ervoor dat die de nodige kwaliteit hebben. Je stelt je analyses eveneens ter beschikking van de diverse stakeholders zodat zij hun beslissingen kunnen nemen. Aan de andere kant bekommer jij je eveneens om de follow-up van de evoluties in het domein (impact op de berekening van de rentabiliteit bij de lancering van nieuwe producten, het veranderen van tariefstructuur enz.) om de potenti√´le impact op onze activiteiten te analyseren.

Binnen de afdeling Data & Analytics maakt het Risk/ICM Data Delivery-team deel uit van Data Transformation Risk & ICM en is het verantwoordelijk voor het exploiteren van de data van het domein Risk & ICM voor het berekenen van de rentabiliteit en de positie van de risico‚Äôs van de klanten, segmenten, producten, metiers enz. Het team identificeert transversaal en gecentraliseerd de behoeften van de diverse betrokken partijen in termen van de visualisering en architectuur en is verantwoordelijk voor diverse taken:

ontwikkeling van cockpits: visualisering van het financieel/commercieel rendement en van de positie van Risk voor de segmenten/klanten/producten
verslagen opstellen en bestaande verslagen automatiseren: die worden opgesteld op basis van definities afkomstig uit geharmoniseerde gegevensbronnen
ad-hocanalyses: bijvoorbeeld op een categorie van klanten, een bepaald product enz

De afdeling omvat multifunctionele teams met o.m. data engineers en data analysts.

De Data Analyst is in de eerste plaats een aanspreekpunt in het domein van de kosten en de provisielonen en de aanwending van de gegevens daarrond.

De Data Analyst maakt deel uit van de Data Visualisation community en bepaalt en deelt in die hoedanigheid de best practices op het gebied van datavisualisatie.

Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. We zoeken vooral een straffe persoonlijkheid met een learning mindset.

Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan als je iemand bent met:

een STEM diploma (Science, Technology, Engineer, Mathematichs), of een diploma in handels-/economische wetenschappen en/of relevante werkervaring
een voorliefde voor cijfers en een sterke analytische capaciteiten
een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid en een interesse in business en marketing concepten
sterke communicatievaardigheden

Je scoort extra met:

tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans) en kennis van het Engels
oog voor detail en datanuances
het vermogen om een massa aan gegevens samen te vatten en om te zetten in kerninzichten

Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Niet alleen heb je de mogelijkheid om je weg te zoeken in een job die je leuk vindt, wij bieden je ook nog een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

Een mooi loon net als de mogelijkheid om een Flex-budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.

description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

You will be a key member of the sales operations team, working hand-by-hand with the Global Sales Ops Manager. At Glovo, it is in our DNA to do more with less, and your job will be to optimize the sales department across all markets.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Develop market analysis and identify strategic insights. Being able to bring down the insights to practical actions/recommendations.
Lead the standardization & digitalization of HQ processes. Identify automation opportunities and roll out the new process globally.
Design and improve all our reporting tools.
Define data quality standards, policies, and processes and roll them out globally. You will be the owner of ensuring local teams' engagement and lead its Salesforce implementation.
You Have

Python programming language and data management is mandatory (SQL Preferable)
Bachelor in Engineering, Information Technologies or Business Administration
Project management skills, highly organized and detail-oriented.
Computer literacy; good knowledge of Spreedsheets
Excellent English skills.
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Comfortable working in a high-growth and high-performance start-up with a fast pace.
Problem solver, data-driven with an analytical approach
Previous experience is a plus
Preferable Salesforce experience
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits

Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo

Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

description:
RESEARCH ANALYST | Rotterdam | Fulltime | ‚Ç¨2514 - ‚Ç¨3716

Als Research Analystbij USP Marketing Consultancy ben je verantwoordelijk voor de onderzoeksfase(s) binnen een project op het gebied van bouw, installatie, doe-het-zelf of wonen. Denk hierbij aan het programmerenvan vragenlijsten, het samenstellen van een sample en het analyserenvan de onderzoeksresultaten. Je bent betrokken vanaf het moment dat het onderzoeksdoel duidelijk is afgestemd met de klant en de Projectmanager, en blijft betrokken tot en met de presentatie van de resultaten en de evaluatie van het onderzoek.

Een lopend onderzoek begint met het programmeren en uitvoerig testen van vragenlijsten, die eerder door de Projectmanager zijn opgesteld. Daarna komt het voorbereiden en monitoren van (internationaal) veldwerkaan bod; dit veldwerk wordt online of telefonisch uitgevoerd door een veldwerkpartner van USP. Vervolgens ontferm je je over de analyse van de resultaten in SPSS, waar je veel tijd aan besteedt. Je controleert de datauitvoerig en analyseert deze, waarna je de resultaten gaat rapporteren en conclusies kunt trekken. In de meeste gevallen is het veldwerk kwantitatiefen worden de interviews telefonisch of online afgenomen. Soms werk je mee aan kwalitatieveprojecten, waarbij er diepte-interviews afgenomen worden of groepsdiscussies gehouden worden met experts.

Het varieert per project hoeveel tijd je gemiddeld besteedt aan zaken zoals programmeren en analyseren. Je werkt regelmatig samen met de Projectmanager, de Veldwerkco√∂rdinator en (internationale) veldwerkpartners; er lopen diverse projecten door elkaar, vari√´rend qua omvang.
Er zijn drie Business Units: elke unit heeft een Business Unit Manager als verantwoordelijke. Deze Business Units zijn Constructie, Doe-het-zelf & Installatie en Wonen & Internationaal. De Business Units zijn onderverdeeld in teams en verschillende Teamleiders. Elk team bestaat uit minstens √©√©n Projectmanager of Consultant, een Research Manager of Senior Research Analyst en enkele Research Analysten. Je werkt niet alleen aan projecten met directe collega‚Äôs uit je team, maar ook aan organisatiebrede projecten met collega‚Äôs uit andere teams.

Wat doe je?

10% overleggen met collega‚Äôs
20% vragenlijsten programmeren
30% resultaten rapporteren
20% resultaten analyseren
5% onderzoeksdata hercoderen
15% veldwerk managment

Wat is vereist?

HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau
Ervaring met SPSS is een pr√©
Affiniteit met marktonderzoek
Goede beheersing Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift
Analytisch, doorzettingsvermogen, punctueel

Wat krijg je?

Vanaf ‚Ç¨2.514 bruto p/m (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring)
Bij voorkeur een fulltime dienstverband
25 vakantiedagen
Personal Development Plan dat gekoppeld is aan een trainingsplan
Op korte termijn mogelijkheid tot een vast contract
Gezamenlijke lunch, wekelijkse borrel, jaarlijks weekendje weg

Iedere medewerker krijgt een Personal Development Plan. Hierin legt USP vast wat de groeiambities zijn, welk tijdspad hierbij hoort, welke trainingen er gevolgd kunnen worden en welke ontwikkelstappen er gemaakt dienen te worden. Er wordt twee keer per jaar ge√´valueerd en stilgestaan bij jouw ontwikkeling, maar tussentijds vindt er ook veel sturing plaats vanuit de Teamleiders en Business Unit Managers om ervoor te zorgen dat jouw groeiplannen behaald worden.

USP Marketing Consultancy is h√©t toonaangevende marktonderzoeksbureau voor de bouwsector, de installatiesector, de doe-het-zelfsector en de woonsector. Door onze kennis van de markt achterhalen wij relevante marktinformatie en brengen wij in kaart wat deze inzichten voor uw organisatie betekent, wat u moet veranderen of wat u moet optimaliseren. Maar ook hoe u dat kunt organiseren. Zo helpt USP Marketing Consultancy fabrikanten, retailers en organisaties in het binnen- en buitenland het beste uit zichzelf en hun producten of diensten te halen.
Bekijk de verhalen en updates van onze medewerkers op de LinkedIn pagina ‚Äò Working @ USP Marketing Consultancy‚Äô.

Siamo impegnati a ridurre i nostri impattie incoraggiamo le persone ad assumere comportamenti sostenibili. Per salvaguardare l‚Äôambiente e limitare il climate change, abbiamo sviluppato la strategia WorldClimate, attraverso la quale ci siamo posti l‚Äôobiettivo di diventare una Net Zero.

Join our #iAct movement! Fai il quiz per calcolare la tua carbon footprint e scopri come adottare dei comportamenti pi√π responsabili.

About Deloitte

Deloitte offre servizi integrati di Audit, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro approccio unisce conoscenze multidisciplinari, esperienza a livello globale, innovazione e servizi di alta qualit√†. Make an impact that matters. Questo √® il nostro obiettivo, e ci√≤ che ci definisce. description:
PLAION - Munich

PLAION (formerly known as Koch Media) is an international media company with more than 2000 employees worldwide. As a leading and independent producer and marketer of digital entertainment products in Europe, the USA, Australia and Japan, our business areas include the production of films and games, the purchase and sale of film license rights, the distribution of digital media products and games publishing under the Deep Silver, Prime Matter and Ravenscourt game labels.

For our GamesLab Team we are actively seeking a talented and experienced Data Analyst (m/f/d).

PLAION's GamesLab operates to provide reliable insights that can be trusted and worked on, both on User Research and Data Science/Analytics topics.

Our aim is to collaborate with each team in a meaningful way, to add value to their projects and go together towards a common goal: create the best games possible.

To do so, the GamesLab is structured around two teams of deeply involved experts, each conducting projects in the Data or User Research field.

Combining these skillsets into one team allows us to better understand our player's behaviour, needs and expectations, enabling a relevant teamwork with our 10+ Game Studios.

Fuelled with passion, aiming for impact - this is the GamesLab.

Do you thrive to make a difference? Then jump onboard and join our crew!

Your Tasks

Main goals:

Communicate proficiently, be curious and listen in order to identify valuable data use cases. Then design, plan and develop your analytics projects and share insights following GamesLab's quality standards/procedures and Data Visualisation best practices
Collarborate with our User Research Team to ensure reliable, clear and impactful data analysis that benefits the Game Studios and internal teams
Help the team address new promising use cases and use new tools/methodologies to guaranty continuous improvement and push innovation forward

Your responsibilites:

Query and analyse high volumes of data using an efficient, reliable and commented approach (SQL, R, Python is a plus)
Choose and define appropriate methodologies, metrics and visualisations to accurately understand our players' behaviour, needs and/or expectations
Design and develop Dashboards aiming to be clear and impactful using BI Tools (Power BI) or open source libraries (R/Python)
Help Production Teams in the data collection process to guarantee completeness and reliability of our game's data
Support the Development Teams through all the stages of their games' lifecycle by providing Prelaunch (tests, QA, alpha, beta, early access) and Postlaunch (Premium and LiveOps games) data analysis
Ensure relevant integration of both qualitative and quantitative data in User Research/Playtest reports
Design new tools and help build new methodologies to steer GamesLab's innovation

Your Profile

Curious and committed, you have a strong ability to adapt and learn. You are rigorous, have good interpersonal skills and a strong team spirit
3+ years of experience in analytics and/or data management related role (in the Gaming Industry is a strong plus)
Advanced degrees in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Systems Management, AI/Machine Learning/Deep Learning, a related discipline, or comparable work experiences
Effective communication skills, including presenting and sharing information with audiences across a wide array of technical expertise, culture and seniority
Experience developing production-quality data products in SQL and R (Python is a plus)
Strong technical skills in BI/visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or open source libraries (R/Python)
Experience working with cloud and/or on premise databases, handling both structured and unstructured data (Google BigQuery, MongoDB, MySQL, Redshift‚Ä¶)
Passion for both video games and analytics

What we offer

Employment in one of the most exciting industries in the world: the film and games industry
Partnership-oriented working atmosphere in a modern and broad-based media company
Wide range of training and development opportunities as part of our PLAION Academy
Company benefits such as employee events, fitness cooperation with Urban Sports, bicycle leasing, flexible working hours, 30 days vacation, company pension plan, free drinks, fresh fruit, etc.
Opportunity to share your passion for movies and games with colleagues

Do you want to be part of our success story? We look forward to receiving your application!

The more comprehensive your documents are to us, the better we can get a picture of you. You should upload at least one cover letter and your CV. Please prefer to use our online application form. If you have any further questions, please send an e-mail to jobs@plaion.com.

PLAION GmbH - Lochhamer Str. 9 - 82152 Planegg - www.plaion.de

description:
Teleperformance is a worldwide leader in customer experience management and contact centre business process outsourcing. Our company employs around 420.000 people working in over 265 dialects and languages, in 88 countries, operating across all business sectors and all continents on behalf of major international companies.

At Teleperformance, we do business with people, for people. We want our employees to be inspired and motivated. Our main goal is to make them proud to belong to Teleperformance through job satisfaction and a great work environment.

Teleperformance Spain, with more than 4,700 employees in 10 sites (certified with Great Place to Work, AENOR and Top Employer), is looking for a Quality Analyst with native level of French, eager to develop his/her career with the worldwide leader in outsourced omnichannel customer experience management.

This role requires a professional with a keen eye for details who can work resourcefully and efficiently to assure quality of programs, software and systems.

Your main responsibilities will be:

Performs call, secure email and chat reviews using established quality monitoring forms.
Reviews for compliance with policies and procedures, ensures staff are providing accurate information.
Reviews After Call Surveys.
Prepares quality reports and performance trends.
Provides management with daily and month end call management and department performance reports.
Works on a variety of assigned special projects.

Requirements

What will you bring?

Advanced level of English, any other language will be a plus
Professional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to use procedures to make decisions and logic to identify needed exceptions
Ability to handle multiple tasks at a time and meet deadlines
Technical expertise with spreadsheet and word processing software

description:
Business Intelligence Analyst - Hybrid working model. Permanent opportunity.

We are working on another exciting new opportunity. Our client is looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join their incredible organisation in Cork. This is permanent role with a hybrid working model.

This role would suit someone with at least 2 years or more of commercial Data Analytics experience.

The Following Skills Are Required

A minimum of 2 years' experience in a similar role.
Excellent knowledge of MS Power BI. Strong analysis skills are core requirements.
Ability to translate raw data into meaningful dashboards and reports.
Experience extracting, transforming, and loading of datasets (ETL).
Ability to work with non-technical colleagues from across different business functions.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and techniques.
Knowledge of the development lifecycle of data reports and dashboards.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to explain technical analysis to a non-technical audience.
Ability to run workshops with clients, gathering requirements and translating them to scoping documents.
Ability to write procedural documents and conduct training.
Engaging with key stakeholders and relaying information in a way that is easy to understand and provides commercial (not just process orientated) insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication. Strong attention to detail.
A Bachelor or Master's Degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Analytics, Management/Business Information Systems (or related degree)).

For more information, please reach out for a confidential chat today!

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.
